name: Keith Grisco
text: This guy is rude as can be, was ok at first .We saw his sign on the side of the road and gave him a cal. He missed first appt.  he finally went and looked where we wanted a fence and then gave me a price. After a couple days I called him to start the process, tell him I wanted to go ahead then he started with the BS. Saying he didn’t know if he had the material, wasn’t sure if he could get it. Said it would be 2-3 weeks which was fine because I didn’t need the fence up until then. He said he needed to meet with us to go over this and that and I said well my wife is in town for just a few days and gave him her number. He said he’d call. She didn’t hear from him so I texted him, he said he’d call. Almost a week later he called. My wife said that was last week, we aren’t in town now. Then he got rude as hell again.

name: Matthew Tucker
text: Company rep was extremely rude on the phone, like I was entirely wasting his time inquiring about material costs. Zero customer relationship skills and I won’t ever consider this guy again.

name: Faith Hope
text: I had a great experience with this company.  I recently moved to the area and was searching for a fence company to replace my fence and gate.  Someone recommended Swearingen so I gave them a call.  They gave me a fair quote and did an excellent job. They were very professional and were out on time and the work was done on schedule.   I have more fence work that will be needed in the future and will be calling them again! Great people quality work and fair price.  Thanks Swearingen Fence and Deck!! I'm very happy with the work you did.

name: Don Harris
text: They just replaced a large portion of our  driveway and sidewalk. They removed the cracked sections, hauled off the debris and replaced the concrete in one day. All the workers were GREAT! They were very polite and even engaged my grandchildren who were watching. Everyone knew what they were doing. Rarely do products or services meet expectations and never do they exceed them. In this case they exceeded ALL my expectations. I would highly recommend this company should you need any remodeling, fence or driveway work. It was a pleasure to do business with them.

name: Bill Lewis
text: Very professional and we have used them for years at different houses I feel very comfortable recommending them to anyone they are the best

name: Austin Taylor
text: I was flexible on appointment time and contractor arrived late for a time he set. I wanted him to quote a deck build and privacy fence. I was looking for options on building the deck and he was visibly frustrated that I just didn't have a set design for him to quote. As an engineer and a business owner I understood that, but thats often part of the process. Then he mentioned he would reuse the existing rotted ledger board on the house. I kept my mouth shut but I was definitely on guard after he said that. Next I wanted him to quote a wooden privacy fence around a pool. We came to an area that required a metal section of fence across my driveway.  He told me it wasn't an option to use anchor bolts on concrete for the posts.  As someone he has a fair amount of experience about anchoring I flat out told him it was if he did it correctly.  Once again he got very irate. Then he told me it would take $7000 to cover the 60' section of driveway.  I pointed out that the metal section across the driveway is the same width as the 20' wide pool I wanted to fence off - it does not require anywhere near 60' of fence to go across a 2-car wide driveway. He got mad again when I told him this - but, I mean it's just so obvious.  He stormed off, saying he and I weren't going to get along and I could find someone else. A frustrating waste of time and certainly did not inspire confidence in me that this contractor was competent. He may in fact be competent, but with people skills like that you might never know for sure. I rarely write reviews but in this case I would definitely exercise great caution if engaging this person in any improvement project.

name: Christopher Smith
text: From the moment I first called for an estimate to continued follow-up, Swearingen Fence has been AMAZING!  Mr Swearingen, the owner, took all the phone calls, and followed-up personally.  When things altered even slightly, he called or texted instantly to keep us up to date.  He and his team have were extremely professional, courteous, and timely.  The work is GORGEOUS.  His fees were very reasonable, and he was honest about everything without us ever feeling pressured about the different products.  Even when our HOA audibled and wanted us to put another gate on, he and his team easily made it happen without concern.  I cannot recommend this company enough!

name: Warren Carr
text: Their attention to detail and making sure everything is right with customers is unsurpassed. Beautiful craftsmanship!

name: Manny Jarogene
text: Castro's Fence did an excellent job on my 4ft × 200ft wooden privacy fence. Pedro and his family are honest hard working people and did a professional job from the estimate to completion. I highly recommend them for any of your fence needs at very competitive rates.

name: Amber Keyes
text:
Highly recommend them! They offer competitive rates, quality work and completed job on time.

We have 5' brick pillars every so many feet around the property. Our last fence just went up to the pillars leaving space between the fence which did not really provide a lot of privacy. Also since the pillars are only 5' tall most people can see right over them. On the second day of work, Pedro and his crew started framing. We noticed that they had included the space above the brick pillars. Which was a surprise cause we had never considered that. Pedro said, "You wanted a privacy fence, right? Well then it should include filling in the foot above the brick pillars." Now we truly have a privacy fence. Its been amazing not seeing every person that walks by our house looking into our yard.

resp.text: Thank you

name: RADIO SWEETHEART
text:
For years people have encouraged me to install a fence. I was not interested in having one. I was finally persuaded to get a fence and the journey began to find a trustworthy contractor who would value me as a client.

There were some twists and turns in my search and I am so thankful that a knowledgeable friend recommended I contact Castro's Fence. Pedro Castro is the type of person I enjoy doing business with for a number of reasons. He is a professional. He does quality work. He knows how to expedite the process smoothly so your dream fence can become a reality.

A standing ovation to Pedro and the members of his team for designing and installing an outstanding fence.

name: Allison Bailey
text: Pedro was so polite and professional. Just a couple days after I called he was able to come give me an estimate, and fit us into his schedule quickly. His team came in and completed our fence in record time. It looks amazing! We highly recommend Castro Fence!!

name: Chris Heath
text:
We had part of our fence fall down in the recent storms and needed to decided between repairing or replacing the ~20 year old fence.  Five quotes later, review searching, etc. we decided to use Castro's Fence.

Glad we did. They worked with us to ensure it was done on our schedule, allowed us to make a few small customization to the fence to ensure it fit our needs, etc.  The two small issues we had during construction were corrected nearly instantly.  Communication was solid (if I sent a text I always got a response within 15 minutes), price was good and the workmanship is, as far as I can tell, great.

Definitely recommend these guys if you need a fence!

name: S Saladino
text: These guys did a great job! My fence job was pretty large, around 3/4 acre of fenced area. They had a reasonable price and the work was done in 2 days including the demo of the old fence. Really amazing to see the crew pull this job together!

name: James Lunsford
text: Highly recommend. They did a great job and finished job on time. Give them a call for all your fencing needs!

name: NICK AHMED (Nick Ahmed Auto Sales)
text: I had 210 foot long fense installed, door closes behind you , these people never put door handles , Called the owner and they totally refused to fix the problems. Horrible job

resp.text:
Hello nick
Sorry if you feel that way the gate only come with one handles  always for extra handles  is up to the owner our package come with only one handles
Thank you..

name: HD Ryder
text:
I did business with New Market Iron Works several times in years past and the product and service was always excellent. Sadly, this is no longer the case.

My last order was in July of 2020 for small job at which time I paid a substantial deposit.As of mid April 2021 I had not  received the order or a final drawing showing what they designed in response to my comments.  This in spite of numerous requests for it.

Questions I had about my order status received responses of "It's a small job" so it is not at the top of their priorities, or "We've had problems because of COVID-19", or "Your job is probably in powder coat".

Last year they said the order would probably be delivered in mid December 2020. That would have made delivery 5 1/2 months after the order was placed. Promised responses on status & drawing did not happened.

I expressed my displeasure with my experience with them after waiting for nine and one half months to get what I ordered.  Their response was to cancel the job and refund my deposit.  I received the refund check - taped to the inside of the mailing envelope. Apparently they can't handle constructive criticism.

Overall a terrible experience and I don't recommend this company.

name: Christian Phillips
text:
The quality of their work is good, but it doesn't matter if they don't answer the phone or respond to emails.

Edit:  I originally contacted you via phone July 8th.  I would have been in touch sooner, but nobody answered the phone until the third day I called.  The woman that answered the phone told me to Email photos of the mailbox needing replacement.  I did.  I was given a quote of $335 for a mailbox post.  I am not going to send a check for $335 without any form of receipt or order form.  That price information was passed to insurance for reimbursement for the damaged mailbox (a much more pleasant experience than dealing with whoever answers your phones).  The email that was sent on the 23rd was sent by me.  It was requesting that someone from your company call me, since over the course of 15 days I couldn't get through once.  They called back the next week while I was at a job site and unable to place an order.  I asked them to call me back later or the next day and was told "No.  You'll have to call us back.  We're busy.". I gave them one more chance when I left a voicemail on the 7th of August.  This was one of two times my call went through.  That was the end of any interaction I had with New Market Iron Works.  They didn't call back over the course of the next week, so I bought a mailbox and post from Lowes instead.

resp.text: We replied to your email on 7-23-20 with all the information you requested.  I have forwarded it to you again.

text: Nothing but good things to say about our experience. They quoted us a price for exactly what we wanted, and they were communicative to help us work within our budget. name: Holly Leeth
text:
EDIT: There was a miscommunication with information about replacing our boards. They amended the situation and came out to replace the warped boards at no cost, which we appreciated.

We had 4 boards warp terribly a few weeks after the fence was installed.  We contacted the company to inquire if they would fix it for us and they said it was going to be a $100 dollar visit plus any additional for supplies that they would need to bring with them. They said warped boards were only covered under a 30 day warranty and we were at around day 40. For a local company to take a hard line stance on this 30 day window, to me, is not the best way to present yourself to a previously satisfied customer.

We highly recommend American Fence Co. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. Very professional, dependable, great communication, and wonderful craftsmanship. Amazing quality at the best rate. Should we have any other fence needs in the future, we will certainly use again.

name: Robin Greenwood
text: Dependable, trustworthy, communicative,  and wonderful craftsmanship. American Fence Co. provided us with a sturdy and beautiful fence that met all of our needs. Our project had elevation changes, privacy concerns, pet containment, lawn equipment access, and beautification priorities. All of which were met with their professional and knowledgeable team. After a walk of the property and listening to my needs American Fence Co. made suggestions with material and provided different price points to work with-in my budget. They suggested a pre-stained wood that has an extended warranty for the privacy fence and black coated chain-link along the back of the property which backs up to a wood line to keep the area feeling open. The pre-stained fence pickets with cap and trim allowed the project to look complete once installed without the normal next step of finding a painter 3-6 month after install to stain or paint the pickets after the wood accumulates to the climate. I would highly recommend the American Fence Co. and their team for your fencing needs. Their prices are fair and competitive while providing quality and lasting fencing.

name: Whitney Bell
text:
Jackson and his team were great to work with. Everyone is slammed these days in the construction/remodeling business, so I did not hear back immediately, but I was not surprised as I assumed they were very busy. Once I did hear back, Caitlin was super responsive and answered all of my questions. I knew nothing about iron railings, so I had a lot of questions.
Jackson and Isaac handled the measurements, created the skeleton railing, and completed the install.  They are both very attentive to detail and personable. They made sure we understood the process and were happy with the final results.
I did receive 2 other estimates, and Allen Iron Works offered the best pricing and best timing. I am very pleased with our railing and would highly recommend them.

I couldn't be more pleased with how it turned out

name: Paris Lady
text: Our cast iron mailbox pole broke from the yard guy backing his car into it. The pole was 70 years old. My Mother mainly wanted to keep the ornate work that the mailbox rested on. Little Hardware quoted a price of 287.00 to weld a new pole to the scroll work and the wait would up to 3 weeks. My Mother said "Call Allen Iron Works. They have been around for years and will give a fair price for repairs". They welded a new pole and while I waited for only 20 minutes. They charged us 40.00 which I felt was very reasonable. That was a year ago. Tomorrow I will go again for a custom flagpole that has to be made and I have complete confidence the price will be reasonable. The entire staff treated me with kindness and respect. My Mother was so excited and happy to see the mailbox iron work back in place like it hadn't changed at all since the 1940's. A businessman once told me "It's repeat business that you always want to strive for. That's the secret of success". He's right because Allen Iron Works has a customer for life with me.

name: Gregory Creech
text: I recently bought a house that came with an electric fence. Our Invicible Fence has been a significant asset to our family and to the quality of our dogs life. Though my wife and I wanted to allow our two boxers access to our entire yard we really did not want to put up a traditional fence which would reduce the openness of our property. The Invisible Fence provided us the solution we needed. Our dogs now have access to the front and back yard and don't have to be let outside on a leash. We decided to have our fence separate the front yard from the back as there are times when we don't want our dogs in the front yard. This has worked out great and I'm glad we chose this option. Additionally, we had the fence section off a portion of our yard for a vegetable/flower garden. We did not do this at first but we just couldn't keep the dogs out so after a year or two we had Invisible Fence come back out and run a fence around our garden...problem solved.
As far as the quality of the product, in the 10 years we've had the fence the only issue we had to call about was my fault. I ran a plow to close to the fence and severed it. Fortunately it was a quick repair as the technician has the equipment to find the severed line quickly.
One final point, my impression of Invisible Fence of Huntsville's owner, Troy, is that he has a genuine passion and understanding of dogs which allowed my wife and I to comfortably follow his suggestions. name: Hillary Arcocha
text:
Invisible Fence has been a life saver for our three dogs! When we first moved into our house, we were concerned with how to contain our curious, fence jumping hound, Hannibal. Our yard isn't really set up well for a physical fence, plus the escape artist has a 6 foot vertical jump so it just wasn't practical. We found Invisible Fence at a home and garden show and later called to have them come out and give a quote. A week later we had our invisible fence installed and began training the hound! Troy (and Jack Fate) is great at working with excitable dogs and spent a good amount of time working with Hannibal on the first visit. It went so well we only needed the one training session and Hannibal knew where the boundaries were and not to run. When we acquired two more dogs, we had them added to the fence and again training went great. Our neurotic Jack Russell puppy had it figured out in two days which is the fastest she's learned anything, and our Shitzhu had it down pat in 10 minutes. Both are chronic runners if they get the chance so it's a relief to know they will stay in the yard now.

Any time I need batteries, I can call the office or contact Troy and he'll either drop them off if he's in the area or I pick them up just a few miles from my house, usually the same day. That's a huge convenience for me, and a life saver when batteries suddenly die! Everybody I've worked/spoken with at Invisible Fence has been delightfully helpful and pleasant, I highly recommend them especially for escapist dogs.

name: Miles Cantrall
text: OK, it has been one week since Troy installed our invisible fence and I am writing my review.   I wanted to wait a full week because I had my doubts that it would work with my two two year old Doberman Pinschers.  Troy said it would, as well as work for our older untrained and UNTRAINABLE Shih Tsu!  I had my doubts, especially as one of the Dobies doesn't like bicycles after having been run over by a bicyclist.   We had paid Lowes to install a fence in part of our yard only to discover it was going to take almost 90 days for them to install it.  We called Troy after about 2 months and he said he could fence our entire yard in about a week, at much less than what we had paid Lowes.  Following rhe instructions Troy gave us we had all three dogs off leashes on day 2.   The dogs are happier having the run of almost our entire yard where we had originally planned to only fence 1/4 of it.  Best of all, when Troy came back for follow up training, he brought little discs that we put on either side of our kitchen island and set them so the Shih Tsu could pass through yet the Dobies are blocked.  No longer must we prepare meals while the Dobies hangout in the kitchen trying to eat our dinner before we do.  Better still, we put a disc just inside our daughter's bedroom door to keep the Dobies out so the cat isn't bothered by them and has a safe place.  Oh.....and we have a swampy section that runs across the backyard.   Troy waded through it doing the installation.  Snakes, what snakes?   The system works beautifully and the dogs and the humans are all much less stressed.   I whole heartedly recommend Troy and his Invisible Fence company.

resp.text:

Thank you for taking the time to review Invisible Fence of Huntsville's products and services. Your pack was a pleasure to work with!!!

You have a great property and glad we let the dogs have maximum coverage of their area including the pond!!!

name: kathy speedy
text:
We just moved to Madison, AL and knew right away we were going to have an Invisible fence put in of some kind at our new home. I googled a couple places and ended up talking to a young lady with Invisible fence. She was so nice and informative that I made an appointment with Troy.
When Troy came out to look at my yard and to get to know our precious doggies. I expected him to show up to  look, quote and leave. Instead he got to know our dogs' personalities and got to know me! He took time out to sit in our yard and really work with our dogs. He gave me lots of information and was available whenever I needed him. Troy is not just here to sell a product, but he is here because he is a true animal lover! Invisible fence is a great product and I'm glad that they have Troy representing them!

name: Margaret Sabatini
text: Amazing. Perfection. Could not ask for anything better !

resp.text:
Hi Meggy!

Charlie is an awesome dog!!!!  We appreciate your business and the opportunity to serve you.

Troy

name: lenita davis
text:
What a game changer it was by installing an invisible fence for our dog, Max.  Max is a one year old Border Collie.  It had become increasingly unfair to him to be confined to a small space.  Up until a month ago, Max's options were limited to being in the house or waiting for us to come home to let him out and play.

We finally decided to call Invisible Fence of Huntsville.  Troy came out and to meet Max and us and completed an initial assessment. He is so personable, professional, and most of all kind.  Max really liked him.  Troy took great with Max.  From our conversations, you knew that Troy is passionate about his work with animals.

The following week, Troy returned for the fence installation.  We marked off the area and he went to work.  From start to finish, it took four hours which included the first dog training (e.g. adjusting the sensation,  reassuring  Max.)Troy returned several days later for the last dog lesson.   By then, Max was acclimated to his new found freedom.  He understood the boundaries and how far he could push before he was "corrected"!  He was now free to frolic, play, and "herd".  There was also an immediate impact to my family.  We were regimented to take Max out a specific times... and no-one wanted to take him out at night, in the cold or the rain!  All we have to do now is open door. Max takes care of the rest!  Moreover, there were no accidents in the house to clean.

We strongly and highly recommend Troy and Invisible Fence of Huntsville.  We appreciate you!

name: Dewanna Staup
text: Great product. Great support and training.

resp.text:
Hi Dewanna,

Ivy and Sugar were a pleasure to work with.  Thanks again for rescuing them!

We appreciate your business.

Troy

name: Nora Fielding
text: Fabulous company!!  Worth every penny, Troy is awesome with animals!!

name: Debbie Rappuhn
text: Debbie Rappuhn- Heart of Alabama Save Rescue Adopt- HASRA.  We are a dog rescue in Killen, Al. and we had Invisible Fence come and install an invisible fence for our dogs.  It was a great experience and decision.  They were so professional and easy to work with.  We received useful instructions and if we ever had a "whoops" with our multiple constructions, they were there by phone or in person to straighten it all out!  I will always recommend them for installation of invisible fences.

resp.text: Appreciate your kind words, Debbie and greatly appreciate what you folks do at HASRA.  Your organizations is a finely tuned Canine Saving Machine!!!!!  You have a compassionate crew there and that reflects great management.  Thank you for your business.  Give Butch an extra biscuit for me ;)  - Troy

text:
Randy is honest and always does a great job.  Most recently, Randy added a run of chain link fence to my back yard to help with my dogs.
Always easy doing business with Alabama Fence.

name: Robert Hurd
text:
BEWARE: This company is removing their business from Google and then re-adding it back with 0 reviews. They had 7 reviews at about 3.5 stars with 2 of them being 5 stars from the owner.

My original review:

Company came out to move fence due to property encroachment. The work was fine ($1100 to move fence 30 inches one way. New posts only). Afterwards I noticed broken PVC pipe around the posts they dug. Come to find out they dug straight through my sprinkler system in two different places. I called the owner and he seemed to not know what I was talking about but offered to come fix the issue himself. But also noted he has never fixed a sprinkler system before. I chose to have a sprinkler company come fix the issue and he told me to let him know how that went. I assumed he was going to offer to pay for their mistake. Sprinkler company came out and fixed the issue and I attempted to call Alabama Fence and they never answered or returned my call. I would not recommend.

name: Cindy Woodall
text: My husband and I have been doing business with this company for over 10 years, owner is honest and has handle all our jobs in a timely manner.We  always called on Alabama fence for our rental properties because they are trust worthy with extremely competive prices.The company is fair and the workers are kind and do excellent work always leaving job clean not messy. I recommend this company for any fencing you might need done.

name: Stacy Harris
text: After reading reviews I made the decision to go with Alabama Fence and which I’ll always be greatful that I choose them to do my fence. Not only did they did do an excellent job but they did it in a timely matter. Two weeks ago they installed my 6’ fence partial combined with a 4’ chainlink fence around my home. I too had a undergound sprinkler system but I was told to call 811 before they did any digging to make sure nothing was underground to be damaged. Thank you guys for a great job and we love our fences!!

name: judie a Godwin
text: super nice guys and they do great work very happy.

name: Bobby Lang
text: Loved working with the guys from Alabama fence today awesome work in the rain

name: Joan Adams
text: This is our 3rd fence, at different locations, by A+ Quality Fence Company.  The crew is efficient, very respectful of our property and does an excellent job every time!  If the need arises, we’ll use them again!!

name: Tanzania Davis
text: I love the quality of this fence. They were quick and did the job in  two days. I Highly recommend. this company.

name: Sherry Edwards
text: We had them come out in November 2020 due to damage from the hurricane. They measured our privacy fence and gave us an estimate. Once we got approval from the Insurance company in March/February, we called to schedule an appointment. We were told that the price of wood had gone up, so the price may go up. Ok we understand, but wait, we are sorry when we were out there in November, we didn’t measure your fence properly, so the price will be different as well. We were like what. They came out remeasured and the price tripled. We tried several, and I mean SEVERAL times calling , asking to speak to a manager or the owner. We left messages, no one returned our calls. On April7, 2021, I spoke with Leslie. I explained I needed to speak with the manager or owner. Oh they aren’t here right now, would you like to leave a message. I said, we have left numerous messages, and no one calls back. She advised she would give our message to them. She called back, and obtained more information, and assured me someone would call back!  Guess what, we haven’t heard anything. SO DO NOT USE A+ Fencing!!!! They are a bunch of incompetent people !!!!!!

name: Patrice Walker
text: The company built me a nice deck on my home, and screened in my back porch. My deck is absolutely beautiful.  I will recommend this company.

name: Hawk Tuner
text: Called for an estimate on building a deck after Thanksgiving. Had to wait two weeks for an appointment. Two gentlemen came out for about 15 minutes and took measurements. Informed me they work an estimate up. After a week I called the company. The person I spoke with said the gentlemen were there in the shop and will ask what the issue is. He never called back so I called again the following week. Same answer, he never called back. I called for a third time and was informed the same answer. Never called back. I guess this company does not need the work. I DO NOT recommend this company for any needs you may have. Very poor customer service.

text: We just got our fence installed by Shelby Fence Company. They did an amazing job. They came yesterday to pour concrete for the post so that it would dry over night. Shelton and Chad were very professional and available for questions. Shelton said that if we have any problems to contact them and they will take care of it. There was a gap on the gate that has to be there to allow for expansion, but I still wanted it covered a little. Chad found a way to take care of it, it was very creative. Such nice guys!  We highly recommend them.

name: Alesha S. Bailey

name: Eric Wilson
text: Didn't work out decided to go a different route. Have cash on hand. No real complaints.

name: Anthony Hamilton
text:
Update: 5 months in and the gates are sagging

They were 1.5 hrs late. They talked us into putting toppers on our posts, but they cut the posts too short to put toppers on and have refused to replace them. multiple toppers are below the fenceline! The fence still has green spray paint on it from the store. They talked us into arched tops-- which turned out terribly uneven/non-symetrical. There are overcuts everywhere. The arch on the frontside of the fence doesn't light up with the backside (of the same panel) of the fence. Every cut is splintered and jagged. They have nice gates and they are balanced well. They have refused to fix the issues. I hope we don't have to escalate this.

name: Eddie Graves
text:
June 18th crew arrived to start demolition.  I was informed the entire job would take 3 days.  Equipment issue occurred, and work stopped.  Day 2 (6/19)  Remainder of fence taken down, then the next problem.  It was originally agreed existing posts would be extracted and new posts installed to avoid damages to sprinkler system.  Their removal system was not working, so I agreed to let them saw existing posts to ground level.   Day 3 (6/20) Remaining posts set and cross beams are up.  Work to begin installing pickets but no pickets available.  How can you have a job scheduled, know lumber needed,  and not have purchased in advance?  The company had received half payment for job.  Day 4 (6/22)  Pickets have been purchased,  Sprinkler system has been damaged and needs repaired.  Company paid repair.  The gentleman sawing the posts to the same height of the top of fence was not as tall as the 6’ fence.  This resulted in posts being sawed off at an angle, and numerous adjacent boards were marred because of the chain saw.  In addition, boards were split, some boards sawed into, and others were installed without using a level.  I had 2 gates installed and neither were up to the standards that I expected.  Day 5 (6/23) Finally the finish line.  My wife noticed a couple of small things that needed attention.  The supervisor was not very receptive to her concerns and seemed agitated she would question the workmanship.  We felt they were rushing to get to the next job.  I could not stand over each employee to see that the work was being done properly.  This falls under responsibility of the job supervisor.   I raised these issues with the rep.   On June 25th, rep came out and inspected  issues in question and agreed our issues were not to their company standards.   On a text dated July 7th, I was assured these “touch ups” would be taken care of and owner had approved necessary repairs.  Almost two weeks later, the crew came out to make  repairs.  They should have known materials needed for this appointment, but once again, the needed materials were not in their possession.  I told them “no problem”, get the lumber and come back in a couple of days.    I texted the rep after they had gone to inform him of the problem, and  was told it would be rescheduled in a few days.  After several texts to reschedule, I finally heard back on July 31st.  I was then informed the “touch ups” were NOT warranted, and no further action from the company.  So, for 24 days I was misled regarding the repairs.
Would I recommend Helena Fence and Deck?  NO.
1.	You do not know if they will be on the job early enough to finish on time because they must get supplies for the day’s work.  If the stores do not have the needed materials, then your job will be on hold until store is resupplied.
2.	You would need to inspect all the work as it is being done, because  lack of follow-up to repair any issues that are discovered after they have gone.
3.	One of the supervisors on job is not receptive to suggestions, therefore making it difficult to communicate while the work is being performed.

name: Timothy Christian
text: They responded fast prior to installation and had quick availability. The crew was nice but the quality and repairs after installation don't justify a 20% premium over others in the area. For instance they installed pavers on the side of the house for our garbage and recycling bins to rest on but they didn't use leveling sand or joint compound. The individual pavers would wobble. I had to removed all the pavers and re-install them correctly. Currently our side gate flexes when you open and closes, they tried to repair the gate two times. It's still not completely correct and the repairs were sloppy. Communicating with the owner is difficult, I will probably pay another company to repair the door correctly and fix an unsecured post. Overall I'm not fully pleased.

name: Betty Sexton
text: I have a Beautiful deck.!  Brian Barnes & crew got the job done.  Good price, good people. Definitely I would recommend Helena Fence & Deck!

name: Patrick Servat
text: Send a message as usual fence companies do not return your calls

name: Keith Colwell
text: When I called the first time, I was cut off midcall when Don of Cox & Don saw a customer walk in and told me he'd call back within the hour. Several hours passed and I called back again. Iwas able to make an appointment over the phone with Don of Cox & Don for the following Tuesday. I was told that'd I would receive a call a could of hours before too confirm the appointment. No call was ever received and come the appointment time, no one from Cox & Don Fence showed up. I did not call Cox & Don back to reschedule as they appear to be too busy for residential services.

Calls when he says he's going to call. Shows up when he says he's going to show up. Gets the job done professionally. And is so very easy and kind to work with.

Cox & Don Fence

text: Company very prompt and professional does great work

name: Isidore Burnstein
text: Just felt I would like to comment on the two young men you sent to put my fence up. They have been extremely thoughtful, courteous, and done an excellent job. If you remember, my sprinkler system was so close to the line we felt it would be damaged, they were so careful sprinklers are fine.

name: Frank Watkins
text: Great guys

name: Landon Cartwright
text: The highest quality residential fence in the area. This man takes great pride in his work and always treats his customers right even after installation.

name: Bill Cambron
text: Exceptional, great work, timely and affordable

name: Matthew Koss
text: Tusco has been great to work with. Both their field and office staff have were very responsive and were more than willing to work with us as a team to solve challenges that arose from some of the unique conditions on our project. The installation + training of their security systems were seamless. I highly recommend Tusco!

name: Teddy Rhodes
text: All around Great People

name: Mike Lamon
text: In 2014 an F1 tornado came through my neighborhood destroying much of the fencing.  My neighbors and I contracted Tusco to replace the damaged fencing.  After several years some of the replaced fencing began to lean.   We contacted Tusco, who sent a representive out to investigate the problem.  He determined that some of the posts had not been treated by the company Tusco buys them from.  Tusco promptly  replaced the fence posts, making our fence new again.  We very much appreciate Tusco's response to the problem, and the professionalism of all who assisted us to include Julie in the office, Rick the supervisor / investigator, and the men who did the repair work.

name: GR82B A MAR10 martin
text: Absolutely the best company in the world!

name: Jeremy Horton
text: Very impressed with the workmanship and quality of their installation.

name: Amanda Provancher
text: Very very very rude. Do not recommend. Very reckless

resp.text:
Amanda, we apologize for any negative impression you may have gotten from our company or employees. If you don't mind, can you please elaborate on your grievance with Tusco? We are a commercial perimeter security contractor, and it is unclear how we may have given such an impression to you personally as we conduct business solely with commercial contractors, property owners, and governmental agencies.

Thank you,

Tusco, Inc.

name: Tom Tully
text: South Gate installed a black aluminum fence on a retaining wall running along our driveway.  If is a very sturdy and nice looking fence.  The installers were very pleasant and often took time to explain what they were doing.   This is our third time to do business with South Gate and we will not hesitate to do business with them again in the future.

name: Miko Hill
text: I booked with this company to have a fence put up and was told It would be up within 2 weeks along with my neighbor. They came within a few days and put up poles but not the fence. A month later both my neighbor and I still only had poles. She called on numerous occasions and they never returned a phone call until after she left a review. A friend of mine closed down the street and had her fence put up before mine. No one kept in contact with me to let me know when they would be returning to finish the job. They are very unprofessional. I would rather have all of the wood removed from my yard then to pay someone that treats customers this way.

name: Viette Smith
text: Less than stellar customer service & communication .... Fence looks great though! Received a quote 03/08/21, and work would begin in 2 weeks along with a few neighbors followed up on 03/16/21 regarding the installation day, stated next ( no exact date given) no further communication. Post were  installed 03/23/21 or 03/28/21. Due to inclement weather conditions around those dates they were not able to complete. Received a text 04/05/21 that they would complete my fencing on 04/06/21. Work completed 04/06/21. Spoke with “B” w/ the company and was met with an unpleasant customer service experience. Happy about the finished product but not the lack of communication and customer service experience.

name: Joe Waller
text: Great company! Mrs. Bobbie and her team did such a wonderful job at our home. They installed both a chain link and wooden privacy fence and we couldn't be happier! Thank you!

name: Kam F
text: My neighbor and I initially contracted this company to install our privacy fences the first week of March 2021. We were told that the fences would be installed in 2 weeks. On Wednesday March 24 2021 workers from the company came out and installed wooden poles only in our yards and not the actual fence. They damaged my At&T internet line and At&T had to come and and reinstall the line which I am being charged for. I have called several times and left voice mails begging on March 25 and so has At&T. South Gate fence has been completely unresponsive. I am not pleased with this company at all.

name: Eugenia Bankhead
text: I had a fence put up over a year ago and now the fence door is dragging . They will not come out to assess the problem, see how to fix it, or even give me a Day when they can come out to look at it because they do not have anyone  Or any other jobs in the area. I have been waiting over a month to get this problem fixed. No one will communicate with you.  If I pay good money to have your product installed then I expect you to stand behind it and at least come out to assess why it is not working properly. I would not use this company again

name: Keith Kennedy
text: Won't call back after multiple messages.

name: Blake Jones
text: Fence was supposed to be started in 2 weeks. 4 weeks later the job has not started and I cant get a reply from the office or the owner. Calls, voicemails, and texts...NOTHING! I have used them in the past with a few problems but this is ridiculous. Might as well build your own fence

name: Steve Chapman
text: Couldn’t be happier with the fence installed to replace a rotted privacy fence. Fence looks so much better than I expected it too. Any future needs of fencing, I will definitely call South Gate Fence Co.

name: Joshua Cooper
text:
As with most customers who have posted reviews for this company, I paid them several thousand dollars to install a fence.  Mine was for my newly purchased home.  Specifically, I chose a vertical wooden fence made from pressure-treated pine, complete with two gates.
I had several issues during the pre-installation, installation and follow-up periods, which I will outline below.

1.  The estimated time to beginning work was underestimated by about 1 month.  I understand working in the Alabama heat can be taxing and the need for delays in work.  I also understand that some jobs take longer than expected for one reason or another, but 4 weeks (in my humble opinion) is not acceptable.  I suspect that the company takes on more jobs at any given moment than they are capable of completing in a reasonable time frame.

2.  There were several details about my fence specifically that were not done to my request.  I won't bore you with the exact details, but suffice it to say that my requests were clearly written on my contract, which was signed by the owner of the company.  To South Gate's credit, they did resolve these specific issues prior to completion of the project.  However, I think this shows a lack of attention to detail and poor communication within the company.

3.  I was out of town when the fence was completed and was contacted by a clerk in their office being asked to pay via phone.  I was hesitant given that I had not seen the final product, but did want to pay the company for services rendered -- so I did.  When I returned home I found that one of the gates was crooked and not what I deemed to be an acceptable level of work for the price charged.  I called and requested this be fixed.  I was told they would be happy to return to the site and fix "any issues" that I had.  This was 2 months ago.

I have emails documenting all of the above, and more specifically the companies promises to fix their shoddy work.  I'll conclude simply by saying that I am not the only person to have issues with this company.  Specifically, I am not the only person who has found it almost impossible to have any recourse with the company after they get their money.  All-in-all a very unpleasant experience, but a learning experience for this first-time homeowner.

name: Justin Wise
text: South Gate Fence did an excellent job on our backyard privacy fence! Our kiddos now have a place to safely play and it looks great. Everything from the estimate, customer service, work, and articulation of the fence was top notch!

name: Jessie Parris
text: I had a fence put up period within a few months a gate started dragging. They will not come out to assess the problem, see how to fix it, or even give me a Day when they can come out to look at it because they do not have anyone  Or any other jobs in the area. I have been waiting over a month to get this problem fixed. No one will communicate with you.  If I pay good money to have your product installed then I expect you to stand behind it and at least come out to assess why it is not working properly. I would not use this company again

name: shane goggins
text: My wife and I are very happy with the new Fence, it change the look of our property and the installer Wayne was a super nice guy enjoyed watching him work. Lol ( we highly recommend them )

name: John Cruse
text: Great Job! They did exactly what they said they would do! They under promised and OVER DELIVERED! Everything went smoother and faster than what they estimated. It was by far one of the best business dealings I have had in quite sometime. Very friendly, professional, and high level of integrity! I would recommend them well before other companies. Thank you Southgate for a job well done!

name: JohnnieF Orr
text:
This company sucks  all posts are loose, I have  called back numerous times and have explained that the gate
fell off the posts. and the posts are loose the owner came out and said  he would  repair the problem, and stated this is normal.. Normal
I don't think a gate falling off and  loose posts is normal.  It's been 2 months and he never came back to repair  it. I  told him the  top rail is crooked ( see pictures)
and he tells me  that happens. Also the top rail is separating from the  2x4 that they are nailed into  look at the pictures see the spaces?
Check out the bottom of the fence boards every  one of them  are now separated from the frame...

This company says they do a  lot of  work for the city...
No  wonder the city is falling apart.

My opinion--- this company is nothing  but a get the money, and go on to a bigger job
Cant face the fact that they  messed  up.
Could care less about a  homeowner.
Unresponsive to phone  or email
I hope they see this review, If they think they  will take  any type of legal action against me for  me  writing this  review
bring it on. The proof is in the pudding.

I do  think the next time I see these people I will be the plaintiff  in court.

Shame I have to give them one star  but I actually would  like to give them   ZERO STARS.. Matter of fact I'd give them a black  hole.. Stay away from this company.

name: Michael Williams
text: They responded with a quote for a fence in a timely manner.

name: Robbin Collins-Lint
text: Amazing job!!  I really needed the fence done quick and what was estimated to be a 5-7 day job ended up being less than 3 with just a few small things left to do after the 4th of July. Even though they were booked with other jobs they made sure I was taken care of,  the installers were very nice and professional and both went above and beyond   Price was very reasonable too.  Thanks so much guys!!

name: Brad Parker
text: Save your time and effort by not calling this company! They won’t answer no matter how many times you call, doesn’t matter if you leave a message because they aren’t going to call you back. I’ve been calling and leaving messages for months and tried multiple times throughout the days.

name: Mitch Hughes
text:
Love our cantelevered gate with Viking solar operator!!!  Wayne and his installation crew are top notch!!! DAniel can be difficult to get I touch with.

Would definitely recommend these guys to my friends!

name: Gregory Bend
text: Food was delicious, waiter Alton was exceptionally good nice young man

name: Trina Morgan
text: DO NOT...JUST DON'T!!  We hired SouthGate to fence our backyard.  They came out to give an estimate and told us that it would take 2 to 3 days to complete.  They said that the process would start that next weekend.  They didn't start until 3 weeks later only to find out that she did not include the sides of our yard in the estimate.....what kind of sense does that make? Why would we just want the front and back if our yard fenced??  She said that they would add the sides....now here it is 3 weeks after the initial start date and I have an incomplete fenced backyard. The fence is crooked and uneven.  The post are about a foot away from the house leaving huge gaps for anything to get through. I am VERY unsatisfied with the work and professionalism that this company has shown. They had to hire people to come on and give good reviews for them because I dont see how anyone would be satisfied with their service.  I am still waiting on you to complete what you started SouthGate.

name: Jonathan Freeman
text: Great Job! I couldn't get the images to upload but trust me they did a great job on our fence.

name: jerry logan
text: They put up a six and half tall fence with a solar slide gate well about 40 foot of my two hundred feet fell over and my gate has quit working and they cant fix it been pushing it open for a month now would not hire them again for nothing.

name: Meloni Robbins
text: Great work.

name: Thomas Bishop
text: SOUTHGATE OR NO GATE

name: Ricky Wade
text: Great service

name: Grant Carodine
text: This is the third fence Redstone Fencing has done for me. They are always professional. They price competitively and build a quality fence. Highly recommend! Disclaimer: This is my most recent project they completed. It is by request the posts are longer in some places.

resp.text: It's been such a pleasure doing business with you again, Grant! I'll be sure to share your kind words with the rest of our crew because I know you'll make their day. If you ever have a fourth project down the line, I hope you'll keep us in mind. - Austin, Owner

name: Yanique Rolingson
text: CUSTOMERS BEWARE!!! I wanted to give this company NO stars, but in order to post I had to give it star. My husband and I decided to do business with this company and it has been one of the BIGGEST mistake of our lives.  They painted our fence the wrong color as well as gave us old, split wood.  We called them a few days after the job was completed and Austin sent out his men to replace few of the woods, NOT ALL, after he guaranteed to fix all the split wood. He AVOIDS/AVOIDED our phone calls and emails, plus they do NOT have a physical location that you can go to, if there is a problem. This is definitely a RED FLAG! They also built our fence 12 inches over into our neighbor's property and when we called him to correct the mistake, he GHOST us. This is our first time installing a fence and we thought we could trust Austin (owner) at his word when he told us that the color of fence was approved by the HOA when he spoke to them and that the wood would not split. Our neighborhood is new, and our house was the 5th one to be built. We honestly thought that Austin had spoken to HOA regarding the color, now we have to get it repainted and Austin chose not to rectify his lie. This company is a scam and we reported them to the BBB. Redstone Fencing CANNOT go on profiting from other people's hard earn money. They do not honor their agreement and do not correct their wrong. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!! THEY ARE SCAMS.

resp.text: Yanique, first off, I'd like to apologize if you've had any trouble getting in contact with us. You should always expect me and my team to return your call quickly. As far as the fence is concerned, it's disappointing to hear that this is your impression of our work. We were more than happy to come out and replace any damaged wood. Our team should have replaced everything that was agreed upon. If anything is ever not quite right, we're happy to work with you to figure out a solution. Give us a call so we can see what can be done here: (256) 753-3623. -Austin, Owner

name: Charles Chen
text: Love our fence. Great work and communicates thoroughly. Willing to work with you on details and specifics. Sometimes busy on calls (you know they do good business), but they always call back.

resp.text: Charles, I'm proud to hear you love how the fence turned out. You can always count on our team to communicate with you throughout the entire process. You were great to work with. If there's anything else we can do, be sure to reach out! -Austin, Owner

name: Kyle Cossey
text: Recently used Redstone Fencing at new house and am very pleased with the final product. Their team can in and knocked out getting the fence installed in under 2 days while dealing with lots of rain, while also being very professional and courteous through the whole process. Company was also very competitive with their pricing compared to others in the HSV area. Would highly recommend to others.

resp.text: Kyle, thanks so much for trusting us with your fencing. The rain posed a challenge, but we were more than happy to knock this job out quickly for you! If there's ever anything else we can do, be sure to reach out. -Austin, Owner

name: Todd M
text: Poor quality work.  Broke sprinkler system and did not tell me.  Missing screws and many boards were not even screwed in except a screw.  Gap between boards is 4 to 5 inches.  This is a shadow box fence and in some places out can see right through it. Found 6 screws in my driveway.  I would look elsewhere to get better quality.

resp.text: Hey Todd, upon completing your installation on June 23rd, we did a final satisfaction walk-through together where you approved our work as satisfactory. For that reason, we were surprised to see that you had posted a poor review on Google that you were not satisfied with our services without ever reaching out to us from June to September. After seeing your review, we reached out to work with you to make things right, but you had already made the repairs yourself. If we had been aware that there was a problem, we would have fixed it for you immediately in June. We always aim to provide our customers with the high-quality services that they want -- and our warranty is here to ensure that this always happens. We appreciate your feedback, and we would be happy to assist you with anything you need in the future. Please reach out to me if you you need anything else.   -Austin, Owner

name: Casey Perkins
text: Based on some reviews I might not have chosen this company but I liked how they did my neighbors fence. So I took a chance and so far I am impressed. Yes they have some refinements that they could do but no one is perfect. They did a better job than I could and better than 4 other fence companies I used in the past. To include the one of the big 2 in this area (TV). I did invest time by marking my property line, fence line, and sprinkler heads. I checked the holes before it was filled. Even with my prep work they hit 3 sprinkler pipes that I did not know was in area but they repaired them for free. They accommodated most of my last minute changes. I am truly 100% satisfied with the work. No wood fence  company can give you a trouble free fence but can make any minor repairs easy. Yes you do have some communication lag time but I did get answered along with a few delays. But in the end it was worth it and we worked together... Let's hope part 2, staining the fence  goes as good or better!

resp.text: I'm glad our supportive online community led you to us, Casey! That said, I'll be sure to share your feedback about how we can improve with the rest of our team because I know we can do better than this. If you'd like to discuss anything further offline, you could always give us a call at (256) 753-3623. - Austin, Owner

name: Rachel Brooks
text:
We hired Redstone to build a fence for us in November 2020. Everything looked great. Well, lately my dogs have been busting out of the fence. There are no dig marks, they’re simply walking right under it. We called them and were told to install tent stakes.
Those didn’t work, they’re still getting out. I can move the fence with one hand. We have been calling almost every day, desperate to keep our dogs safe. After a week or so, someone came out and took photos. We were told someone would be with us that day. Nope. I called today, 4 days later, and it went to voicemail.
The dogs got out again today. We caught one just as she was heading across the parkway. She wouldn’t have made it to the other side.
If they’re busy and can’t get to me right away, just say so. But not returning calls and making empty promises isn’t a good look. If you want to keep your dogs safe, I would go with another company.

resp.text: It's disappointing to read this review here, Rachel. While we care a lot about our fences being high-quality, we care about the safety of you and your family, including your pets, just as much. I understand your frustration, but I want to assure you that we're working as hard as we can to alleviate your situation.  -Austin, Owner

name: Faran Rolingson
text: On November of 2020 we used Redstone Fencing to install a shadow box fence around our new home.  On January the 5th of 2021 we realized that the pickets were splitting, cracking and warping. We also realized that the gate looked imbalanced due to one of the fence post not leveled. Some of the pickets were missing screws in certain places. Upon realizing these issues we started to measure the distance between pickets and realized that they were inconsistent.  The gaps were so big in between some of the pickets that you could see through the fence from the sidewalk. We spoke to Austin the manager and he sent a few of his guys to look at the fence and the gate.  His guys said to me that there was nothing they could do about the gate.  They manipulated the picket on the gate and said that it was the best they could do. I spoke to Austin the evening and his responds to using inferior material/wooden pickets was that he is not responsible for the material quality and that it is not covered under warranty. Redstone Fencing; managed by Austin is a very unethical person and business.  I would not recommend this company to anyone.  We are currently stuck with a three month old fence with splinting, cracking and warped pickets.  Redstone Fencing have decided that they will not fix the problem.

resp.text: Faran, it's very disappointing to see that this is the impression you have of us. While I understand your concerns, I hope this clears up any confusion. We don't accept payment unless you are completely satisfied, and we did a walk-through of the entire fence to make sure you were happy with it. We stand by the quality of all the materials we use, so I can assure you we would never use low quality wood. We use #2 grade lumber for all pickets. Even though your fence was not under warranty, our guys took the time to fix 20 pickets for you to ensure that they were level. It's disappointing to see this review after all of our hard work to makes things right. I hope you'll see that we tried our best to make sure you were happy with the finished product. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to give us a call. -Austin, Owner

name: Tony Trieu
text: Redstone Fencing installed the fence for our house in early March 2020. Since it was installed too far inside the property line in the back; one sprinkler head is outside and one is underneath the fence. Our neighbor's fence in the back is ~ 2 feet back from our fence line. Also, the double gate is so close together and uneven, we could not close it. Austin said someone will come to fix it but more than 1 month nobody came, we email him about the fence off property line but got no reply. We had to fix the gate ourselves. Now we have to hire another fence company to move the fence back. Until now Austin never contact us. Very bad services and quality.

resp.text: Thanks for reaching out, Tony -- I think it'll be helpful if we cleared some things up on our end. As stated in our contract, we're not responsible for locating the property line since we're not surveyors. We mark where the fence would go, and every customer agrees to the location -- we already informed you that we can't confirm where the property line was beforehand. We offered to help get your gate assessed, but unfortunately, someone else was asked to do that already. If you'd like to discuss anything else further offline, please don't hesitate to give us a call at (256) 486-8745. - Austin, Owner

name: Katlyn Banks
text: I will always recommend Redstone Fencing. First off, our first contact was with Morgan and she took care of our needs right off the bat. Always great and fast communication from start to finish. Austin and his guys take their time to build great fences that will last. Their team is very dependable and will show up early in the morning and stay till late at night to make sure the job gets done. We also really liked that the owner, Austin, oversees all of his guys work. He does a walkthrough before leaving the job, just to make sure things are perfect. He is very reliable and explains everything thoroughly. Great and reasonable pricing too, for great work! We are IN LOVE with our fence, we’ve had it for over a year now and it’s still in perfect condition!!

resp.text: Katlyn, from Morgan to Austin, it's so great to hear that our team was able to walk you through the entire process! You can always count on clear communication and a quality job. Thanks so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. If you ever need anything else, be sure to give us a call! -Austin, Owner

name: Kathy Garelick
text: I highly recommend Redstone Fencing. The team from Redstone are very professional, reliable, and hard-working men. They even persevered through the rain to get the job done. They were meticulous; cleaning up after the work was finished. They all clearly demonstrated integrity and expertise. My fence came out beautifully. Austin went above and beyond to ensure that I was fully satisfied. I would absolutely use them again, and I have recommended them to neighbors.

resp.text: I'm only happy when my clients are happy, Kathy -- thanks for recommending us! I always want to respect our customers' space, so it's awesome that our efforts impressed you. If you or your neighbors ever need anything else at all, we're just a call away. - Austin, Owner

name: Sophia del Rio
text:
I could go on and on about the professionalism, attention to detail and care Redstone Fencing took in constructing my new fence. Austin listened to my concerns about drainage, access, and my wandering dogs. He came up with many expert solutions to keep my fence secure, and went the extra mile to finish out the gate by attaching fence boards to give the gate a cohesive look.
Pictures will tell all, behold my beautiful fence!

resp.text:
You can always expect us to go the extra mile! Thank you for taking a minute to share about your experience. Enjoy the fence, and don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything else we can do!

-Austin, Owner

name: Jessica Fidoe
text: Redstone Fencing did a great job for us. The job was done in three days and one of the days, it rained on and off. I really didn't expect them to show up that day but they came and worked around the rain and stayed until dark to finish everything. The final product is beautiful and exactly what we asked for. They didn't drag their feet and there was no hassle. We've had so much trouble trying to get someone to come out and redo our fence, but with Redstone Fencing, it was so easy! Would highly recommend this company!

resp.text: We're always here for our customers, Jessica -- rain or shine! I'm glad you loved the final product as much as we do, so I'll be sure to share your feedback with the rest of our team. If you ever need anything else at all, we're here for you. - Austin, Owner

name: Gus Prouty
text: The guys did a great job! They had a very uneven hill and they did a great job making it look right. They also used the PostProtectors on all the 4x4's so I know this fence will last!

resp.text:
Everything we do is made to last, Gus! Thank you so much for reaching out. If you ever need anything else, just let us know!

-Austin, Owner

name: Morgan Derden
text: Very satisfied with the fence that Redstone Fencing's built me. They showed up on time every day, walked me through the process, and finished the job quickly. I have had my fence for over a year now and it still looks great! I would highly recommend this company to anyone.

resp.text:
It's great to know you're still enjoying that fence, Morgan! I appreciate you taking the time to reach out. It was a pleasure working with you, and we're happy to lend a hand anytime!

-Austin, Owner

name: Wendy Hicks
text: I had a damaged fence with a new puppy coming and they showed up promptly not only repaired the part of the fence that was damaged but checked all the fencing to make sure it was going to be good for my new pup. The repair was done better than the original install could not be any happier. Highly recommend.

resp.text: It’s our pleasure making sure we repaired your fence to ensure everyone's safe and happy. If you ever need anything else at all, please reach out. - Austin, Owner

name: NEEL SHAH
text:
Put a gate up and the dang latch fell off in 6 months. Like is it that hard to put threadlock and use beefier metal screws.

Screws lacked lock washer too. Just went out with thicker screws and hammer drilled em in with red locktite.

Update 1/20/21:
Looks like you also need better record keeping. $600 for a gate added to fence. Really pathetic the easiest part was overlooked.

resp.text: Although I'm glad you're making the effort to reach out, our team couldn't find any record of this project by your name. That said, I know our team would love to connect with you. If you'd like to discuss anything offline, please don't hesitate to reach out to our management team at (256) 753-3623. - Austin, Owner

name: Ricky Bailey
text: We are very happy with the service from Redstone Fence.. Very professional job by being on time and cleaning up after the days work. We recommend Redstone for your privacy fence!!     Ricky Bailey

resp.text: I always want to respect our clients' spaces, Ricky, so it's awesome that our team's professionalism impressed you overall! Thanks for recommending us -- we're always here for you if you ever need anything else. - Austin, Owner

name: Nick Cochran
text: We're quite happy with our experience with Redstone Fencing. They were very clear about when they would be coming out to do the work and kept to that. Furthermore, they were responsive when we had any questions both before and during the build. Additionally, we're happy with the quality of the work and price.

resp.text: It's awesome to hear that our team's responsiveness left you with such a great impression, Nick, so I'll be sure to pass your compliments to the rest of our team. Thanks for trusting us for the job -- we're always here for you if you ever need anything else. - Austin, Owner

name: Chris CJ
text: Redstone fencing came out to give me an estimate and never gave me the estimate. This company wasted my time. They were contacted and asked about the estimate they said they would send it but never did.

resp.text: Chris, I'm so sorry to hear if you never received your estimate. This must have been a miscommunication on our end. We would love the chance to get that over to you. I'm sure you'll love the quality of our fencing. Don't hesitate to reach out so we can make this right: (256) 753-3623. -Austin, Owner

name: Rachel Wesson
text: Great value, awesome quality. Austin and his crew were professional and punctual from start to end. We love our fence and appreciate the job well done!

resp.text: It's great to hear that you were happy with our work, Rachel, and I'll share your kind words with the rest of our crew. I always want to respect our clients' time, so it's our pleasure to be punctual from start to end. Thanks for trusting us for the job, and I hope you'll keep us in mind if you ever need anything else. - Austin, Owner

name: Charles Stewart
text: Our interaction with Morgan at Redstone Fencing has been outstanding.  She has been very responsive and professional in returning phone calls and answering all of our questions.  Regretfully the home we were purchasing had multiple structural issues so we decided not to purchase.  Upon receiving my text reminding us of our scheduled estimate today, I realized that in the stress of walking away the house, we neglected to cancel our appointment.  When we called to cancel the morning of, we were again able to speak directly with her and she was very understanding.  You can tell a lot about a company by their communication and character so I'm leaving this review in support of that. name: Han Do
text: They installed the fence for us in March. Austin Phelps (the owner) said that the fence was installed at the property line. One week after, the gate wasn't close, & we also found out that the fence wasn't installed at the property line. We called & sent them email, but got no reply. We filed complain with BBB, they didn't reply to BBB either.

resp.text: Thanks for reaching out, Tina -- I think it'll be helpful if we cleared some things up on our end. As stated in our contract, we're not responsible for locating the property line since we're not surveyors. We mark where the fence would go, and every customer agrees to the location -- we already informed you that we can't confirm where the property line was beforehand. We offered to help get your gate assessed, but unfortunately, someone else was asked to do that already. We did try to reach out and also have been cooperating with you via BBB. If you'd like to discuss anything else further offline, please don't hesitate to give us a call at (256) 486-8745. - Austin, Owner

name: Kristi Newby
text: Showed up on time and were very professional.  Did a great job, completed on time, and cleaned up after they were done.  Absolutely recommend this team!

resp.text: Punctuality is our top priority, Kristi, and I'm proud of my team for honoring that. Thank you for trusting us with your fence project, and we'll be here if you need anything else. - Austin, Owner

name: Charles Wilson
text: WOW!!  You told us; you do not pay the team lead when you agree the work performed was a bad job; however, you still charged us full price for the bad job. No wonder you can’t keep keep good help. This does not seem fair to the team lead.  The completed project was amateur work, less than do it you self quality if I had the time.  If the team lead wasn’t paid, why were we charged full price for a bad job?

resp.text:
Hello Mr. Wilson,

Thank you for the feedback. We are sorry that you feel the job was not to your standard. We understand you are not satisfied with a portion of the fence that does not run straight due to sprinkler lines.

Although you were not present at your estimate, our primary contact, Mrs. Wilson, who was very friendly and respectful, communicated to us what she believed was expected from you, to the best of her knowledge. We understand that there may have been other things you wish you could have requested for the fence. However, because we did not meet with you at the estimate, where those requests would typically be communicated, our team began your project to the best of our knowledge on what was expected through communicating with your wife.

Upon discovering multiple sprinkler lines running at different angles, our team had to either bring the fence in or build it out wider to avoid damaging the sprinkler lines. We discussed this problem with the you over the phone and you preferred to move the fence out wider. We explained that doing so would not allow the fence to run straight along the property line without intruding onto the neighbor’s property. Despite this, we were told to go ahead and build out.

Upon completing the project as directed, we prepared for the final walk through. Per policy, our team does a walk through with the customer to make sure they approve of and are satisfied with the project. At the time of the walk through, you communicated to us that you did not like the lateral portion of the fence because it did not run straight, as we previously discussed. You asked us if we could deconstruct that portion and rebuild it closer in after you spoke with the sprinkler company. Our team agreed to come back to make any changes after you talked to your sprinkler company. We also planned to improve a few other things on your fence, some being non-warranty matters, and other being warranty issues we are responsible for. As for moving the fence line, which takes additional material and man power, we explained that we can move the fence, but because it is not a warranty issue and would require deconstructing the newly built fence, there would be an additional cost. You told us to give you a price for moving the fence to desired location after sprinkler lines were moved.

Before we began on the non-warranty and warranty issues of the fence, excluding the lateral fence portion, we double clarified our plan with you and your wife. You said you were leaving, and we asked if you would return for the final walk through for this new fence portion. Instead, you said no, your wife, whom was also present, would handle it. We noticed she appeared confused, so we asked if you were sure that she was responsible for signing off on the final walk through, and again you said yes.

After we made all the changes, we discussed with you, we then contacted your wife as instructed. She informed our team that you told her not to do the walk through after all. We explained that the customer has to do the walk through before our team can leave the job site. She explained that she did not know what all you wanted fixed.

Fortunately, we had a document stating all the things you wanted to be changed, so she called you, and you told her she could do the final walk through. We walked with her around the fence perimeter to check off and ensure she was satisfied with the final project. Once receiving her approval, she signed documentation which stated changes were made, customer was satisfied, and customer understood and accepted that the right side of the fence was built to avoid sprinkler lines. For completing the additional work of moving the fence line, additional documentation stating that “this is not a warranty issue and Redstone Fencing is not at fault.” Customer then paid for the work, and our team left the job site.

We apologize if there was any disrespect or dissatisfaction. According to the contract your spouse signed for the two of you, we fulfilled our promise and you were satisfied with the job. We still hold our duty to fulfill our one year warranty, so please feel free to reach out to us with any warranty issues.

name: Kevin J Powell
text:
Stay away! The workers are inexperienced, the workmanship is poor, the quality of the lumber is subpar...splitting, bowing...gate already has to be lifted to close... They put the fence up in the beginning of July!  Came back to stain the fence and did not finish!  Ran out of stain and never came back!  Called and left messages...never return calls. Check out BBB website!  This is what others are saying!  These high ratings on their Facebook page are family and workers! STAY AWAY...they are not who you want for a new fence!

Amazing!  I post for ALL to see and you comment with untruths in 26 minutes!  Call me if you want to make this right!  We need you to finish the first coat per the Contract And we have emails where you have stated the work you would perform!  You are in breech of contract!  You haven’t finished the job!!!

resp.text:
Kevin, I'm sorry for the miscommunication that happened here. I'm sorry for the miscommunication here, Kevin. We finished the fence installation and came back to stain it a few weeks later. At the time, your wife had requested a second coat of stain and decided to do it herself when we informed her it would incur an additional cost. We believe our great recommendations are here because we always make sure we're doing our very best to go above and beyond for all of our clients, and we were also happy to come finish some extra repairs for you that didn't fall under warranty. We mostly communicated with your wife during the process, and we're sorry that the job details became unclear between the three of us speaking separately, but we did fulfill our contract and then some. We hope this helps clear things up, and we're wishing you the best.
- Austin, Redstone Fencing Owner

text: At first I was willing to highly recommend this company to my friends and fellow neighbors. However, there have been 2 separate instances in which I’ve reached out to Reidar and zero response back. This lack of communication alone is very bad business and a great way to ruin a potential great recommendation. I wish he would have the common courtesy to just respond.
