name: Chris Cov
text: these guys do fantastic work no hassle, sure you have to wait a bit but its worth it...

name: Justin Lancaster
text:
A year ago or so, me and my wife just finished building our new house and decided that we wanted a good privacy fence to compliment it. The fence was to help provide a nice private backyard space for us and to give our dogs a nice place to run around.

I started doing some research to see who might be best for tackling this job. I had previously done business with Lowe's and their fencing contractors and was quite pleased with their work. So, they were naturally in the running. About the same time I was talking to Lowe's to bid this out I found a close family friend that highly recommended Reidar and his crew at All Around Fence Company.Within a couple of weeks I had pricing from several contractors but only had my eyes set on Lowe's and All Around Fence. All Around Fence was 2x as high as Lowe's but after speaking with Reidar I thought that they would have a superior product. We agreed on a price of almost $8000 for this and within a few weeks we had a wonderful fence. That's about where the positive comments end.

Within a couple of months I had boards warping so bad I you could see straight through them. Some of the gates started warping etc. I was starting to question this wood was even pressure treated lumber. I am still not 100% sure on this today. More on that later. Anyways as soon as I started noticing problems I called Reidar and texted him multiple times. After several months I was able to get him out here to replace a few of the boards even though he showed up without my knowledge and then when I questioned whether he had been out here or not he just texted me that it was fixed. Well, some of them were but not all by any means. However, I let that go at the time because I figured I had a two year warranty and I would just wait to see if any more started turning and warping. And sure enough, we had more, lots more and the gates were still never looked at from the previous time. Fast forward to today and almost a year later I am still trying to get him to come out and fix this fence. Upon closer inspection it looks like the boards are placed too close to the ground, and in most cases they are in the ground which is causing them to wick up moisture which is no doubt causing the issues. I have had plenty of houses and plenty of fences and this is the first one we have ever had issues like this.

I understand that wood does some crazy things, but I have never in my life seen wood do this unless it wasn't treated. Remember, I am still not convinced that this is. So, with all of that being said, I cannot recommend this company to anyone. The work is not holding up, he doesn't communicate well, if at all, and it would seem the warranty means nothing. If this was Lowe's I guarantee you they would have already been out here and had replaced all of this stuff, no questions asked. I should have went with them instead because I know they stand behind their product and said they could have done this for $4000 roughly. I paid Reidar and his crew almost $8000 and this thing isnt holding up well at all. All I want is for him to stand behind his product and replace what needs to be fixed so that I can move on to staining this fence even though I am not sure it will help much as I would be surprised if I wasnt replacing this thing in a few years. The funny thing is, the fence at our old house is 10 years old and looks just as good as it did the day it was put up. Lowe's did that one and I spent almost a grand staining and sealing it. I am sure that has made a huge difference in itself but the fact is it just seemed to be a better built fence overall compared to this one. I can fix these issues myself but after paying All Around Fence almost $8000 I feel like I shouldn't have to. I hope Reidar reads this and we can come to a resolution on this and then maybe I can change this review, but as of right now I haven't had any contact from him after trying to get someone out here for almost a year. Again, there is no way I can recommend them at this time. Take your money somewhere else.

name: cylde731
text: I have called several times and no one will return my call they are supposed to be and A+ with the Better Business Bureau  but i guess they need the job are they just don't want to work I don't like writing reviews about people but this is one I got to right no one else needs to set and waiting on them to get in touch with them I have left messages for 3 days and they have not called me back yet all I need them to do is come out and give me a estimate but cannot get them to even do that.I'm only put one star   it will not let me post any other way but i did not want to push the start so don't be fool about the one star i had to put  on here to post anyone.

name: TJ Lew
text: I purchased my house in 2018 brand new, and got a fence added on at the same time. Everything looked fine, until 3 years later. My fence is now leaning. My back yard is on an incline so i figured they would have took better measures to make sure it would be stable. I decided to look and see how far the concrete casing was in the ground. It was barely down 6 inches, the casing was small, and also disconnected from the post (gap in between when you move the post back and forth). The fence leaned so much it pulled the nailing from the corner fence connection out. Now I’m currently reinforcing the fence up with 2x4s to make sure it does fall over and until i figure out how to fix it. I couldn’t get a response from anyone to remedy the situation. So right now i wouldn’t recommend Tennessee Valley Fence to anyone when asked.

resp.text: As TJ should know, Tim ran by to look at his potential problem.  Tim did find three or four posts that could use additional reinforcement,  and even though his one year warranty for workmanship expired a little over two years ago, opened a work order.  We expect to help with the issue once his work order is reached.  Hopefully he can wait a little longer.

text: I used sales person Randy, and he helped me find an aluminum fence to install between our pool and patio with a safety latch gate. The crew that came our were polite and careful. What impressed me most was they made sure I was comfortable before drilling and we were all on the same page. I'm very satisfied with Randy and his crew. I would recommend! (local Madison resident)

resp.text: Thank You for your kind review.  We sincerely appreciate your business.

name: New Media Production
text: When it was time to refinish my wrought iron railing, I dreaded the thought of sanding, & painting; especially since some of it was so far off the ground.  Upon talking to a friend about it, he suggested to call Owen Roberts at Tennessee Valley Fence.  Long story short, Owen's guys came out, took the railing to the shop, sandblasted it, repaired it, and covered it with a durable powder coating.  Then, they brought it back and reinstalled it like it was brand new.  That was in 2014.  Since then, it stood up to all kinds of weather and when it got time to sell the house in 2019, we didn't have to do a thing to it for it to shine.  Thanks for the extra effort, Owen!

resp.text: Thank You for your generous review.  Refurbishing coupled with powder coating is a cost effective way to renew old rails, enhancing your street appeal, along with renewal of chairs, tables, etc.  Again thank you.

name: Peter McDonough
text:
Couldn't have been less professional. They came out and took some measurements immediately, then took the better part of a week to come back with an estimate.  In what appears to be a pattern (judging from some of the other reviews here), the estimator conveniently left off an entire side of the yard in his estimate, even after being told to write an estimate for replacing the fence "around the entire perimeter of the backyard".  This lead to a surprise change order halfway through the project adding nearly 40% onto the total cost.  The next snafu was actually getting this job scheduled lol--these jokers take your money up front, then promise some dude will call you in 6-8 weeks to actually schedule the job.  There is no communication from their side, unless you press them, until that point.  At the 6-8 week mark, they will call you at 6am to see if they can "quickly schedule the job for that day".  Obviously, you'll not answer because you'll be enjoying a yummy breakfast or sleeping while you ignore strange calls because its 6 in the morning!  (Side note: they make up the time around closing, when they leave the office 30 minutes early, so don't bother calling the main office line if its around their closing time).  When you finally get the job scheduled, the installers are ready to do an OK JOB!  After specifically requesting the fence rails be lapped over the width of the fence post and secured with 4 nails, the installers completely ignored this request, butted the rails up to each other, and shot in their 2 nails.  The installer told me he'd been doing it this way for 20 years.  That's nice dude, but you're being paid 40% more than I expected at the initial estimate of this job to put in the nails the way I want you to.  It's a fence, not a complicated engineering project.  The installers also ran the entire line without regard to board warpage or shape, meaning the pickets are distinctly not upright at the edges of the yard.  Thanks for your hard work and dedication TVF!  I won't be using you again in 3 years when this fence falls over.

*****reply to owner*********
Your response demonstrates the lack of attention to detail that I've come to expect from your company.  Did you even read my review?  I called your staff "jokers" because they are unserious people doing a mediocre job, not "monkeys".  Also didn't mention credit card fees at all.....so not sure where that came from.  You should apply the same level of attention you expect your customers to apply to your sham estimates. Maybe then you'd be able to run a successful business, and experience the pride of a job well done.

resp.text: We are sorry that we could not please Mr. McDonough.  Our monkeys as he called them on the phone when I requested payment after he had avoided us for two weeks,  work extremely hard to please our customers,  & unfortunately not all customers can be pleased.  Lead times are part of outdoor work, as are change orders when customers change their mind, and unfortunately fees to process credit cards are part of business.  It was the credit card fee that set him off as that was his preferred method of payment as opposed to the free check by phone.   Again I am extremely sorry we could not please Mr. McDonough and we wish him the best.

name: Richard Beevers
text:
Tennessee Valley Fence quoted some features and time of performance (delivery date) that they weren't able to meet. The quality of the fence is fine, but the work is completed by a contractor. There are plenty of options for hiring the same independent contractors without Tennessee Valley Fence as a middle man to save some cost (10-15%). I would recommend competing your project and give strong consideration to the independent operators in the area: Barrios Fence, Right Choice Fence, and others. My opinion is that Tennessee Valley Fence does not provide value for their premium price.

Update: Tennessee Valley Fence did disassemble the gate and remove the 4x6 posts and set the 6x6 posts on Friday, and the crew said they would return on Saturday to complete the work. Unfortunately, it appears that the work will not be completed until sometime after the long weekend. I would have preferred the work be completed in a single day, this is obviously a worse condition than using the 4x6 posts instead of the upsold 6x6s. Not the end of the world, but not great service either.

Regarding TVF Warranty: "TVF EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OR MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. AND TVF DISCLAIMS ANY WARRANTY THAT THE QUALITY OF ANY PRODUCTS OR SERVICES WILL MEET CUSTOMER EXPECTATIONS."

text:
Called Vicki and got all the information and pricing for our 2 acres of Invisible Fence. She was very straightforward about how everything would work and what the pricing would be...not a penny more or less. The day they scheduled my installation there was inclement weather on the horizon, but they got right to work and got my fence installed in the pouring rain and wind! They went over training with me under the cover of our carport and everything with the fence worked great.

About 2 weeks after my installation, I broke a bolt on my ZTR mower while cutting grass and a brace on the front of the deck drug on the ground for a few minutes before I realized it, cutting through two places in my 2-week-old invisible fence underground. I promptly called Vicki and told her what happened. This was on a Saturday. On Tuesday, they came back to my house and repaired to 2 breaks in the fence at no charge.

The level of service here is unparalleled. They get the highest marks from me! Very, very satisfied customer here. Would HIGHLY recommend!!!

During recent Hurricanes Sally and Zeta my 8ft. Privacy Fence lost several large panels, and damaged others. I closely observed the building of a privacy fence around the property and was impressed with the work ethics and quality of the finished product.
I made contact with the Crew Chief of the builders and learned it was All American Fence Builders.
I followed up with a request for an estimate for repair/replacement of my fence. Subsequently, considering the damage to, and age of, the entire fence,  I contracted for the complete rebuilding of
the entire length of the 8ft Privacy Fence.
I was highly and completely satisfied with the finished product. I couldn’t have asked for better quality and workmanship. As I commented to the Owner of the company, “It’s a Privacy Fence To Be Proud Of.”
As a result I would not hesitate to highly recommend ALL AMERICAN FENCE BUILDING to any property owner in need of such services. I would give it a 5 STAR RATING.

name: Paula Malone
text: Never returned my call

resp.text:
Afternoon Paula , this is Jack with All Fences.
Our answering service received a call from you March 25. I am sure we returned your call that day . When I return calls it is from my cell phone 423-394-XXXX. Sometimes people do not answer calls from an unknown cell . No intention was made in not returning your call . Please accept my apology for not reaching you. We are a small company and our office is not staffed as much as  I would like . Covid has taken a toll on keeping a full time office staff . I have copied and pasted how we received your call from our answering service 3/25
“423-987-4383 PAULA MALONE - 21058 RIVER CANYON RD CHATTANOOGA TN 37405 DIFFERNT TYPES CURRENT CHAIN LINK FENCE NEEDS TO BE REPAIRED AND PART NEEDS TO BE REPLA”
I hope this clears up any misunderstanding in us being able to reach one and another . Thank you for your anticipated understanding in this matter.
Thank you Jack
All Fences

name: Sherry Covington
text:
They were FANTASTIC! They communicated with me weekly to let me know where we were in the process of my fence being installed!! Everyone I spoke too was professional and friendly! I HIGHLY recommend them!! The hold true to their word and will make any mishap right!
And to boot, the whole process was like speaking with beloved family!!

resp.text:
Sherry! We strive to make our customers happy! You were so wonderful to work with! Thank

name: Megan Minor
text:
We really really wanted to like this company.  We were told on 3/19/21 we would have our black aluminum fence in 4-6 weeks. We put our deposit down and waited.  6 weeks later, we spoke with Jack whom told us our material was back-ordered.  He told me we should have it 1-3 weeks later.  On May 26th we were told our materials were arriving in a few days and they'd be delivered the first week of June.  Didn't happen.  We asked for weekly updates, however, that didn't happen either.  We called them again June 15th and now finally our fence was finished this morning, 6/23/21...more than 3 months later.  To boot, materials had a big sticker on them saying "shipped 5/28", though when we asked All Fences Co about this, we were told the sticker was not correct.

So, all in all... we were made a lot of promises and they underdelivered which means a very disappointed consumer.  To be fair and balanced, I would like to mention that the workers who came were wonderful and did a great job.

name: amy moody
text: The guys came out and did a great job.  The fence looks wonderful.

resp.text: Amy! We appreciate you and Chris- it has been a pleasure working with you both!

name: Widows Harvest
text: All Fence is an amazing company with even more amazing skilled employees.  Could not have had a better experience. And you can see for yourselves the outcome of their work. And by the way, your neighbors will love you because this design looks exactly the same on both sides.  A win win if you will.  Highly, Highly Recommend All Fence Co. A+++++++++

name: Parker Phillips
text:
After receiving 3 quotes with other businesses, it was All Fences that we decided to go with because they were:
1. The most affordable by about 400-1000 dollars.
2. Had one of the shortest waiting times.
3. Seemed the most professional when speaking to representatives on the phone.

So we went with it. It was originally scheduled for a month out, and after a week and a half we got a phone call saying they could come get it knocked out. Then we had about a week of rain, which put a halt on things. We were always kept in the loop on their plans, so any changes we were quickly notified of. After the rain, they were here the next day. They had a team of respectful, young guys come out and got 300ft of fence put up in less than 5 hours! These guys worked together like a team of Navy SEALS. It was truly impressive to watch.

Right before they got everything finished up, I went outside to take a lap and make sure everything looked alright and the owner was outside. We talked to him for about 10 minutes and he was a pleasure to conversate with. He gave us a thorough description of how to maximize the life of our fence (through staining and sealing) NOTE: his business doesn't stain and seal, he was just looking out for us.

Before leaving he let us know that we were part of the All Fences family, and that if we ever had any issues with it he would run out there and get it fixed promptly. Overall just a great experience. Seriously, I highly recommend!!

resp.text: Parker!! Thank you so much for your kind words! It was a pleasure working with you! We hope you and your family enjoy your new backyard space!  Take care!

name: Greg Balint
text:
From the minute I talked to Jack, I knew the experience with this company would be different than a lot of other contractors I hired. He was very courteous, seemed interested to know me more on a personal level and talked with me through my needs for replacing a fence of mine that got blown over due to age and high winds.  He was very up front about the quote, lead-time to start, scheduling of materials, etc.   Very good price compared to the 7 other companies I called to get quotes.  He handed me off to Nicole who was the coordinator from there on.

Nicole is definitely the epitome of great customer service. She called a few times during the lead-up to getting the materials and fence started to keep me updated on timing. When I had questions, she would always answer her phone and had the info I needed even once when I called after 6pm.  The crew that came out knew what they were doing and suggested some alterations to the original plan to make sure my fence was the best for my situation. They got the posts placed and cemented very quickly and came back the next dry day to finish the fence in just a couple hours.  Overall I wholeheartedly recommend All Fences Co. Great group of people and get the job done right! Thanks!

name: Thomas Gallagher
text: If you want quality service and efficiency then All Fences is it. Their team was very friendly and a pleasure to work with. Their crew was so efficient and did not waste any time. We love our new fence and are thankful we chose them for the job.

resp.text: Thomas! It is important to us that you are completely satisfied with your fence! It was very easy to work with you! Thank you!

name: Chris Davis

text: We recently had a 6-feet tall wooden (pine) privacy fence installed at our property and were very pleased with the experience. This was extremely beneficial since we were getting our fence installed around the holidays. The installers were punctual and worked hard the entire time they were at our house. The owner, Jack, came and checked on the installation midway through to make sure we were happy with how everything was going. This is a family owned business and you could really tell by the way they treat their customers. I would happily recommend All Fences to others looking for fence services.

text: I called All Fences to complete a fence in the yard of a house I just bought. Everyone I spoke to was very nice and seemed to really care about my needs. They did a great job installing the fence and I could not be happier!

resp.text: Congratulations on your new home ! Thank you for allowing us to install your fence for you and your family ! All Fences Crew

name: David Thompson
text:
After reading all the 5 star reviews, we decided to contact All Fence to build and install a partial wood and chain link fence in our backyard specifically for a new pup we where adopting. All was good as expected from initial call, to measurements and quotes,and deposit and installation date.
Not sure how everybody else's process was handled after that point, but ours was completely unprofessional and inconsiderate.
First off we set installation for 3 day period purposefully on my off days, and I'm completely aware of untimely changes in scheduling or things happening out of the ordinary  e.i. the covid 19  and the Easter storms. However, when you are running a business and you make and agreement, you have and obligation to stick to that agreement. And when you cant it's your duty, not the "Paying Customers, to initiate communication, we for whatever reason did not get that common courtesy.  So after not hearing anything from All Fence on day 1, I called on day two. And was told installers would be out that day. Around  12:30 we knew nobody would come, so I called office and asked to be contacted by owner. When Jack the owner called, he immediately sounded irritated by my request for a call and offered excuses of why installation hasn't taken place, never once apologizing  for delay which we weren't to concerned about but the Lack of Communication which was a big red flag for us. And when I tried to explain this Jack the owner continued to try and over talk me with more excuses. After about 10 minutes of back and forth, Jack the owner offered me a refund on my deposit. Which everything in me said do it, however we where already expecting pup and really needed fence built, so I stuck with All Fence  hoping to get back on track with that reputable record we read so much about., and Jack the owner ensured me installers would be here next day. The following day get a call at 830am, saying installers would be here at 1100am. Apparently they booked another installation earlier and and we didnt see installer until about 530pm, and this was just one single guy unloading material. The remaining crew didn't arrive until about 6- or 630pm. We doubted it, but they were confident they would finish that day. Low and behold, around 9pm guy came to tell us they would not finish, but only lacked wood gate to install and would be back in the morning to finish. Before leaving they asked how everything looked, mind you this is at 900 at night and the fence is black aluminum so impossible to see. But one thing that immediately stood out was the bottom of the chain link was loose like a flap and dogs would easily escape. So I pointed it out to installers, and they said they would install tensioner in morning. Surprisingly they came out first thing the next morning, but on a work day for my wife and I. So when I got home after a long 12hr day I expected fence to be 100% finished. The  fence was up, the gate was installed,  but the bottom tensioner was still missing. I immediately text Jack the owner to call me next day because after 12hr workday didnt feel like back and forth. To my surprise Jack was already heading to my home. After looking over job he called his guys and directed them to come next morning to install tensioner. Finally after a stressful 5-6 day process that should've been 3 days max, fence is finished, but still with flaws, that shows a rushed job. I usually never do bad reviews but the unprofessionalism and lack of communication, really struck a nerve with me. I'm glad the job is done but I I definitely will not use All Fence again and will not recommend to anyone.

name: Gary Brock
text: When considering a fence company, Look no further than All Fences.  If you're looking for the best service at the best price, this is the fence company for you.  Highly recommended .

resp.text: Gary- We hope you are continuing to enjoy your fence! Thanks!

text: I am extremely happy with the work All Fences has done for me! I was provided with outstanding customer service and an excellent job was done by the employees. text: James Berry (Project Manager) was great to deal with. He was very responsive to my questions and was easy to get in touch with throughout the process. This was a big job and I was pleased with the entire crew. They called to discuss any questions or minute details that needed to be worked out before starting. I would easily recommend them.

name: Takisha Ellis
text: We had a black ornamental fence installed and we love it! The crew started in the afternoon and worked until after the sun had gone down to complete it. They were friendly, fast, and hard-working AND left no mess behind. Our home is much improved thanks to all fences!

name: Justin Phiillips
text:
Jack the owner is a stand-up guy who truly takes care of his customers, and I would absolutely recommend him on his customer service alone.

I had an ornamental aluminum fence installed by one his competitors (based on a realtor recommendation) and spent thousands on the install. Just three months later one of my gates falls right off the hinges due to poor installation. I called the original installer and requested that they fix it under warranty, but I was stood up on three separate occasions!  When I personally visited the competitor’s office I was told that they wouldn’t repair the gate, because in his his words “the job was too small”. Unbelievable!

That’s where Jack at All Fences came in and helped in a BIG way. I called his office on a Thursday to explain the situation and warned them that it was a small job, and understood if they weren’t interested in such a small task. Jack personally showed up the next day to make the repair...FREE of charge! He explained why the gate had failed (original installer used aluminum screws and over torqued them), he installed stronger steel screws and reset the gate properly. Such an exceptional level of service by someone who wasn’t obligated for someone else’s poor craftsmanship! I’ll be using All Fences Company for our future properties and would highly recommend you do the same.

resp.text: Justin- It was our pleasure installing your fence! We hope you enjoy your fence for many years!

name: Christy Wilson
text: Just had a chain link fence put in for both our front and back yard. We have woods surrounding our yard and a building that we had to work around and James knew exactly how to do.The owner Jack is very nice and helpful. They beat an estimate from another company by A LOT! Thanks so much!

name: R&M M
text: We just moved here and we needed a fence for our dogs.  I called 4 different companies and received quotes.  I used to be self-employed many years ago and also spent 9 yrs in the Marine Corps.  This has enabled me to judge people by what they say and how they treat their competitors.  A good salesman will NEVER speak unkindly towards another company in the same business.  A good salesman will always say what they have done in the past and what they will do for you now.  They will preform and keep their promises no matter what.  This is why we went with All Fences.  Jack was very professional in his manner and made us feel very good about the fence installation.  Now, the best part.  Jr. and his crew came Sat around 8:00am and when they left around 8:00pm the entire job was done with 3 five foot gates installed and one installed across the driveway.  Wow!  What great service.  Jack and his crew did what he exactly told me when he sold us the job, nothing more, nothing less.  Good Company!

He offers excellent customer service & communication via phone or text & I never felt uncomfortable checking on our pending install date & the project was completed in the estimated time frame from day of deposit.

David, foreman, & his 4 man crew were extremely pleasant & did excellant workmanship. It was like watching a well-oiled machine!

I highly recommend All Fences for your replacement or new fencing project!!!

But, to get a 20 minute phone call from the company yelling at me for a bad review, I don't understand how this company does business. Don't give this company a bad review unless you want a lesson on small businesses, social media, and why you're a horrible person.

name: Jason Tucker
text: I would recommend All Fences to all my family and friends. I got a beautiful fence done right and in a timely manner for a lot less than other companies.

name: Caroline Clark
text:
Wonderful company! I called Jack on Friday afternoon and he was at my house Saturday morning. I was convinved my fence needed replacing and had he told to do so I would have trusted his judgement. The fence is 15 years old and looks it! He inspected it and said it was in good shape and only needed some boards nailed down in a few places. He is even going to take care of doing that for me next time he is in my area at no charge. It's quite easy for someone who owns a business to give you their opinion and if you are not an expert they can take your money and move on.

I highly recommend Jack and All Fences if you want an honest opinion, honest quote and quality work done (I had seen a fence he put up prior to phoning him about mine).

name: Charity Davey
text: Three years ago I was desperately seeking a fence builder that wouldn't take forever putting it up and who would also not charge me an arm and a leg. After a few estimates from the usual joe, I met Jack with All Fences and was absolutely taken aback by his professionalism and friendly demeanor. I actually enjoyed having Jack and his hand picked crew on my property. I have children and pets that are important to me and the guys (and gals) with All Fences were very kind and trustworthy. Jack matched and even charged me a little lower than what those other guys were asking to put up a privacy fence and the job was done within 5 days. Let's face it, everyone is happy with a brand new fence but I am here three years later still grateful for having done business with All Fences. My fence still looks great and as stable as it was the day they left!

name: Emily Lawson
text: I called Jack about a quote on Saturday, he came to the house and gave an estimate on Sunday, and the fence was up by Tuesday afternoon.  Needless to say, my experience with All Fences was wonderful!  Jack is extremely personable... a good business man who tells you what he's going to do and then follows through to a T (plus some!).  Jack and his team built their fence off an existing fence line that backed up to my property.  There were a few gaps here and there that I was going to patch up on my own after they finished up.  I came home from work to find that Jack had already fixed those "problem spots" for me!  His quote from Sunday was exactly what he charged me Tuesday, even after an "above and beyond" job. I will without a doubt recommend All Fences to anyone I know who's looking for a high quality fencing job done the right way by the right people!

text: I recently notified Hagan Fence for a quote and installation. I reviewed and accepted the quote and they finally came out and put up my fence. I received the invoice and notified the office of the poor quality of installation and I would be more than happy to pay once the fence is corrected. Nathan states “I understand and will make sure it is rectified “. After a few days of not hearing from them and called to speak with manager Steve Trawick, who was out of office, so I sent him an email regarding the same. I have yet to hear from him.  I also sent the representing employee a text that I needed to pay the invoice and want my fence corrected. He , Sam, was very rude and sent a very condescending response.   I have still not heard from anyone at HAGAN FENCE to see if this had been taken care of yet. I just want to get my fence corrected and pay my invoice. Apparently Hagan Fence is not interested in my issues and don’t want my money. Therefore I do not recommend HAGAN FENCE  PLEASE search around for a more caring company that value the work they perform.

We will not hesitate to utilize Hagan Fence Company for all our fencing needs and highly recommend them to all.

name: ThaBaddestOneEver
text: THIS COMPANY HAS GOT TO BE THE MOST UNPROFESSIONAL COMPANY IVE EVER DONE BUSINESS WITH! I HIRED THEM TO PUT UP A NEW FENCE FOR US WITH DOUBLE DOORS FOR MORE ROOM TO GET THINGS THROUGH AND THEY SENT TWO GUYS FROM THE TEMP SETVICE (BASICALLY OFF THE STREET) WHO HAD ABSOLUTELY NO EXPERIENCE TO PUT UP OUR FENCE WHICH WAS DONE VERY POORLY, SO BAD TO WHERE THE FENCE WAS NOT MEASURED CORRECTLY AND WAS VERY UNEVEN, THE DRILL AND BIT THEY USED WAS NOT WORKING, AND NOT STRONG ENOUGH TO DRILL THROUGH THE METAL BACKING, (SCREWS MISSING) AND IT WAS AN ALL OVER SLOPPY JOB! SO I TOLD THE MANAGER AND SALESMAN OF THE COMPANY I WOULD NEED FOR THEM TO REDO THE FENCE AND TO SEND SOMEONE WITH MORE EXPERIENCE TO PUT IT BACK UP TO CORRECT THE PROBLEM. THEY CAME BACK, TORE DOWN THE FENCE AND REASSURED ME THAT THEY WOULD TAKE CARE OF IT AND I NEVER HEARD BACK FROM THEM! THIS WAS THREE WEEKS AGO! I WILL TELL ANYBODY TO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS BUSINESS FOR ITS A DISASTER AND THAT THEY SHOULD KEEP THEIR MONEY! SO NOT WORTH IT!!!!!!

They send a sales guy out who said he would look at the damage and give me a quote. 3 days later I call him after not hearing from him and he quotes me an outrageous price ($640) for what should have been an hour or two worth of work max - in fact, I ended up fixing the gate myself for $20 in hinges in under 2 hours. Before doing it myself, I called and left a voicemail for the manager of this location to inquire as to why their bid was so high - and I still have not received a return call. Hagan just lost any future business from me.

text: Can’t say enough good things about this company! Hurricane Sally destroyed our entire privacy fence and our yard for that matter, but these guys built us back and it looks fantastic! From start to finish with customer service, to quality and the best price in town, we are very happy customers. All my calls went answered and they did everything I asked. They even came all the way to Daphne to help us out.  Almost all of my neighbors have requested their information! They take pride in their work and I would highly recommend them to anyone! Thank you Turner-Wilson Fence Company!

Tried again for fence debris removal and gave them the benefit of the doubt due to the busy hurricane season. They again promised dates but never came out. I don’t know if the secretary doesn’t communicate to the contractors or what, but there is clearly a break down in communication with this company. I do not recommend this company to anyone. Overall poor customer service.

name: w.j. spin
text:
THEY ARE NOT BONDED AND DON'T PULL PERMITS!

I hired then to come build a fence. Unfortunately, the type of fence I asked for want allowed in my historic district. They assured me they were a reputable company and would pull the permits, deal with the water company, and has company. They never got the permits. Now the city is telling me if they had, then they would have been told that the specs were not allowed. They built the fence and I paid them cash. Because they aren't bonded, I am now responsible for taking down my fence and putting up another one. I all then to fix it and they said no.

text: They only concreted in the corner poles! After hurricane zeta I realized this is why my fence started to sag not even a year after it was built and now the majority of it has fallen down!

resp.text:
All the posts should be concreted.   Please call us back and we will look into this further.  We need the
address and last name.  Thank you

name: Stephen Karnes
text:
Fast High Quality Work at a Fair Price.

They completed my partial (2/3) fence replacement and it looks great.  Everything I asked for was completed the way I wanted it.  There was one issue with 4x4 posts and the soft ground not being able to hold the heavy gates up, and yes they were using concrete on all the posts.  Anyway, they came back out the following day and added 6x6 posts, which corrected the issue.  They did also have to mod the gate location and inset it a few feet into the back yard, which actually gives the gate a better look imo.  All debris was removed.  They even moved some dirt around to accommodate their fencing.  Very professional, very impressed.  May be the luck of the draw of which labor you get from them.

Note that they charge a minimum for a 100 ft of fence for a job.

name: suny havenith
text: These guys were absolutely incredible! I have a very difficult yard to do that at a slope lots of trees and lots of weeds and they work through it treated me with respect I would definitely highly recommend them! I will be using them for other side jobs as well! Not only that, but you can't beat the price they're very fair they weren't gouging like everybody else is! They also finish the job in one day I was completely impressed I can't say enough about these guys it's nice to see hard workers in this area!

name: Donna W
text: John saved the day for me by fitting me in his schedule when another contractor backed out and left me with fencing materials in my driveway. He and his crew did quality work and cleaned up when job complete. I would highly recommend.

name: William Lang
text: We called McCadden's Fencing & Construction to give us a quote on our roof and fence damage from Hurricane Sally. Matt came out took measurements, looked what he would need for our roof. He was so proficient and personable I enjoyed having him at my home. He gave us such great quotes we couldn't turn him down. He arrived to fix our roof when he said he would and was very thorough with his repair. The wife and I enjoyed having Matt at our home we look forward to having him back to replace our fence and inside damage on ceilings and walls. You can't go wrong choosing McCadden's, Matt and his crew for your home needs.

name: Marlene James
text: When I first met John I was excited , a new small business I could support. He gave us price for our fence and mind you it was big 9ft tall in the back( we have a dog who can jump). We gave him the down payment he asked for without hesitation ( after all he had great reviews). He said at first it would take 3 days and it turned into 3 weeks.He told me if would only tear down what he could put back up, they tore 3/4 of the fence down .( we have 8 dogs).He never communicated with us , which was all I asked for. Never returned texts or phone calls.I felt like he took the $ and ran. He eventually told me his woes, personal problems as well as business. It was awful! Well Sally blew threw and we have no fence. No phone call or anything from John . I understand he’s out making more $$. But you have to take care of all your customers so you can grow. It was not a good experience, I wish him success but I would never recommend him.

name: Josh and Kristin Schmidt
text: We originally wrote a review for this business that was positive. He came out to stain our fence and we were satisfied with the work. However, after he came back to our home to ensure that we left him a good google review, he told us that he would come back and stain a small 6 foot section of fence that had to be replaced. It has been a month, and he still has not come back. His communication with us has been past rude. Not a professional business - also he charges quite a bit for his work. Just expected more for the money we paid.

name: kristin schmidt
text: We used this business to stain a fence. When we first contacted him, he seemed kind and knowledgeable. Once he finally did the work, he told us he would come back to stain a small 6 foot section of fence that had to be repaired. It has been a month and he has come up with every excuse as to why he hasn't come back. It would take him 15 minutes to stain that small section, but once he has your money - you are no longer a priority. Also, the way he spoke to me through messages was so unprofessional. I reached out to him on July 24th regarding the small section of the fence needing to be stained, and he told us he would come out as soon as he was in our neighborhood. After waiting 3 weeks to ask if he would be coming out soon - he told me to "be patient." I'm not sure how patient I need to be, but apparently if you want anything done on a timeline - then you're not being "patient." Just a warning to anyone who is looking for a professional business. This would not be it.

name: Peggy Castenholz
text: Paid for a fence- got 10 posts put up in over 3 months. We were patient and empathized with his excuses.  Finally he ordered some materials which just sat on our driveway for over 60 days always promising to show up and materials ended up unusable. Finally fired him- Still has not refunded any of our money-even offered a payment plan.. NOT A DIME.   We will  be seeing John McCadden in court

name: Linda Goins
text: I called John and sent him a couple of pictures of a fence I needed to have removed. He gave me a quote over the phone from looking at the pictures. He showed up the next day and did all the work very quickly and did a very very good job. I would recommend him and his crew.

name: Kaylee Fayard
text: We had absolutely the best experience and are so glad that we went with McCadden's Fencing! We had a few quotes done over the phone but when we called John he was out here that day and gave us a quote we couldn't turn down. We got a custom shadowbox fence that's turned out better than we could have even imagined! The men he has working with him are the sweetest and knew exactlywhat they were doing and had so much knowledge about the entire fencing process. Absolutely will be recommending Mccadden Fencing to everyone I know.

name: Laura Rodich
text: They do use screws, which is a plus, but have trouble fulfilling their promises as to how long the job should take. It's always longer, sometimes by a good bit! Also, during the hurricane two walls of their fence leaned in about 15°. My husband tried to right it with braces and to reinforce the posts by digging deep to pour more cement in and to his surprise he found there was very little cement in the holes in the first place! And what cement was there in many cases was just off to one side rather than having the post-centered in the middle of it. This gave our fence a weaker  foundation when the winds came. They enclosed my backyard a year ago and then came back a few months ago to enlarge the enclosure per my request. John always has excuses for why they are behind or why no one showed up that day...seems to have trouble keeping help and overextends himself by accepting too many jobs and not having enough workers to fulfill them in a timely matter

name: Justin Tucker
text: Great quality of work at a fair price!

name: Becky Glover
text: Very professional, hard working crew. He kept his word, got our fence up and made sure everything was just the way we wanted it. They use quality materials and built a top notch fence!! I highly recommend them!

name: Lori Weatherly
text: I went with McCadden’s Fencing bc of such good reviews & I am so happy I did! These guys are professional, reliable, & trustworthy; have fair prices and do great work! After completing one job, I immediately turned around and hired them for another. I wouldn’t hesitate recommending them!

name: greg w
text: John McCadden is a Joke. He requires a large deposit up front and then uses your money to finish other jobs he already has going. Once he receives your money it is nearly impossible to get a response from him. It took nearly 3 weeks to get my fence completed and the workmanship is horrible. Don't believe the positive reviews.

resp.text: I don't have an invoice for any Greg W? Call me 2519239922 with the weather the last three weeks and finding good help I'm behind and as far as my workmanship it's never sub par I don't leave a job until the customer is satisfied. I think your being unreasonable in life situations send me pictures of my sub par work so I can fix that as far as timing I'm still learning how to schedule and I'm sub par at it I can admit. But bashing my work that's not gonna work my pictures don't lie...

name: Annsley Machen
text: My husband and I hired McCadden’s fences on May 8th and paid the deposit on May 11th so John could order materials for our start date of May 18th. He did not get materials delivered until May 23rd and it was only half of what we needed for the job. The materials sat on our grass until June 1st, killing a large part of our new sod. John then decided he was going to sub out part the job to another contractor because he was so behind, but said he would finish the job himself. The sub-contractor started on June 1st and finished what he was supposed to on June 10th. He did a great job. At this point, we were waiting on John, once again. We have yet to hear from John, even after multiple calls and texts. We have two sides up and there is no sign that this job will be completed. I do not recommend this company and warn anyone who contemplates hiring McCadden’s fences.

resp.text: I'm dealing with lack of help and over scheduling with the lack of help happening right after I took on this job. I sent you the best guy I have to do the job. The deposit has paid for the vinyl fence and Tony to install it. I have been in the field trying to keep everyone of my customers happy and this one I did put on the back burner so to say. There was 1800 dollars still for the remainder of the other fence. You stated you were gonna use another company to finish up the job and due to the circumstances I felt that was the best option for us both. I'm sorry for the experience but I know the quality is there and that's what I stand for. I didn't wanna bring guys without any experience and throw it together.

text:
He has poor work ethics and his reviews needs to show this and is uncompleteness. He has treated me very poorly.

text: We love our new privacy fence! These guys do great work, work fast, and use high end quality materials. Our new fence looks amazing and will last many many years! Highly recommend!!

I'm so happy with the job you and your crew has done on my fence. The attention and effort to do the job right impressed me. Thank you for following up with me on the sealer and maintaining my fence. I would strongly recommend Mccadden' Fencing and Construction.

Thanks again

resp.text: Your the customer that contractors wants to provide services too. Thank you for the opportunity and kind words!

name: Lisa Adams
text:
We had damage from recent storm(Barry)and lost a huge portion of older privacy fence.  Got a referral from a friend who used McCadden Fencing and recommended the company. They were very responsive, totally professional and replaced our fence with a much more stable and beautiful design.
Their prices are very fair and reasonable. In fact, surprisingly, at the time, following Barry, they were covered up in work, but did not take advantage of the storm event.  Moved our project to a priority and I actually had to tell them to stop working and go home. It was late at night!
I will be calling on this crew for many years and their work goes beyond fencing!!!

name: Jesse wilson
text: McCadden's was the only fence company that I called who used screws in every aspect of the privacy fence. Others wanted to charge extra for screws because they only use nails. Also, he only used metal frame gates which was another plus. Overall, he did a great job and I recommend him 100%. He did approximately 220 ft of 6ft privacy fence in a weekend which included a 12ft drive gate and a 4ft walk gate.

resp.text: Thank you for choosing Mccadden's privacy fence. We stand by our screw only design. You can keep the horse I mean dog in the yard now!

If a hurricane comes it will probably be the only thing left standing!

resp.text: We love to install privacy fences. Thank you for acknowledging my hard work as quality work.

name: Fred Stringer
text: I used McCadden’s Fencing & Construction to build a custom style fence in my back yard. I could not have been happier with the entire experience. The service was professional and the product was immaculate! I would definitely recommend!

name: Stacy York
text: We met John by chance at a tire shop. The first thing we noticed about him was how mature he was for his age. We found out in talking to him that he was a young entrepreneur which is something we cherish and in so doing choose to support. We got his phone number intending to add him to our Network of contractors that we could refer to our clients. But he noticed a personal need on our behalf and immediately offered his services expecting to be doing so in charity. The job was not an easy one by any means. He not only fit us in to what should have been his personal time and sought out Tony who was another fencing contractor to have the help needed, but he came and built us the most beautiful fence we've ever seen. Thank you, guys! You are our forever fence and deck, guy John. Keep up the great work!

text: Very professional and excellent service!  I've used them on multiple projects over the years and I plan on continuing to do so.  I highly recommend them!!  They will sit down with you, go over the plans, make recommendations, and assist in managing your expectations of the job.

name: Herbert Cooley
text: Our metal roof was starting to look dull and was turning black on the ends. Our concrete porches and driveway needed cleaning. We called All Clean Outdoor Solutions and scheduled an estimate. They came and gave us a price and were quick to come and do the work. They soft washed the roof and then pressure washed the concrete. The difference was amazing!  I never knew how bad it really was. We appreciate the work they did and highly recommend their services. As an after thought, a friend we haven’t seen for several months asked if we had a new roof. The work speaks for itself!

resp.text: Oh that is so great. We appreciate that you gave us the opportunity and that it turned out as well as it did. We appreciate the review very much and when you need a 'new roof' again, call us!

name: M C
text: My new best friends highly recommend

resp.text: Mike we just saw this- thank you!! I love the way your project turned out and thank you kindly for the high compliment & recommendation! We can't wait to work with you again too! P.s. Your deck and gutter estimate is in progress!

name: julie fontenot
text: All clean did a fantastic job on our home. They were very professional, friendly and the price was affordable! Thank you Rachel and Tracey for taking the stress that hiring a contractor adds to a homeowner. We will definitely recommend your services to all our friends and family!!

resp.text: Thank you Julie. It was a pleasure to work with ya. We were really able to perfect our fence building skills with the projects you provided. We appreciate the business. Call us again!

name: Amanda Hill
text: They did a fantastic job!  Also awesome customer service.  We will definitely be using them again!

resp.text: Amanda thank you so much. We were happy to be back at your place. I mentioned that before you bought it we'd cleaned it for the previous owners. It is a lovely place and we can't wait to be back too!

name: Jim dunn
text:
The appearance of the 2nd floor on the front and side of my 2-story frame house had been bugging me for months.  The north and west sides of the house were covered with a black mold, especially on the north side.  I tried bleaching this mold off myself with my pump hand-sprayer, but it was a no-go.

In mid-October, 2019, I searched on-line for pressure washer businesses who could do this cleaning job and found "All Clean Outdoor Solutions, LLC.  Their reviews from customers were very good, so I called them and set up an appointment.  Rachael and Tracy came out on the day and time we agreed on and gave me an estimate. The price was reasonable so we set up a time for the house to be cleaned.

Tracy began work on the house a day or two later with very satisfactory results.  For our house, it took him between 2-3 hours to finish the job.  Now, that the front of the house is cleaned and looking good, we need the back deck of the house cleaned as well, so I'm planning on giving them a call for that, as well.  They used a 'soft wash' process on my house as pressure washing is sometimes hard on the paint.  They also clean driveways, bricks, roofs, and most types of outdoor cleaning, so they're a 'one-stop' shop!!  I'm glad I found them.

resp.text: Mr. Jim Thank you for trusting us with your project and secondly, we deeply appreciate the kind words to us and about the process. We do strive to provide amazing customer service and leave your projects, no matter what they are, as you'd imagined or even better! We look forward to that call for future work too.

name: Patrick Gibson
text: They did a great job washing down my home in Ocean Springs. Very professional and great attention to detail. I would definitely use them again!

resp.text: Patrick your amazing home was a pleasure to clean. Thank you for entrusting All Clean to soft wash your property & maintain its beauty!

They both worked so hard and did a beautiful job on replacing my sub floors. I am thrilled to have these two help me with future projects!

Your complaints were warranted although it wasn't our typical situation. We do depend on word of mouth and great customer experiences to propel our still-growing, young company. I do apologize for your experience although I know that isn't typical of us. You and I have had other conversations since then and hopefully I delivered a better communication to you then. I hate we weren't able to work together this time Jason but perhaps in the future if you've got exterior cleaning or building needs(we only personally build & restore wooden fences/decks as the rest is subbed) maybe you will call us back. I can understand that part but after not standing up to their  promises or schedule you would think a company like this would have some integrity they don't have none. That was about  2 weeks ago and still no frame and no phone call back to repair what I already paid for!

name: Tyler Morgan
text: Great staff and helpful advice. Will use them for future fencing projects!

name: Jon Futch
text:
- Start date was two weeks after they promised to start; doubt they would have started when they did if I didn't complain.
- Told me project would take no more than 2.5 days
- Project took 5 weeks from start to finish. 450 feet of fence and three gates. Not a big project.
- Crews would show up for couple of hours and then vanish. Then would have to call to get them back a few days later.
- No oversight of work crews; project manager never visited site until I requested.
- Poor communication; seemed like I would always have to call to find out why no work was being done or done poorly.
- No one accepts responsibility for issues, just blame someone else at the company.
- Company very unorganized with little care for what they put you through as a customer and the inconvenience they are causing.
-Owner did finally come out to site at the end - too little to late in my opinion.
- They sure are quick to expect payment when they are finally completed with your fence.
- Would not recommend them to anyone and if I run into issues with warranty work on this fence in the future would not let them work on it anyway.
- This is my first review of anything, ever.

resp.text:
The original start date for this job was the week of  5/11-5/15 2020. Work began on 5/22/20. Unfortunately outside projects can not always meet a projected time frame, due to weather and other unforeseen circumstances. On 5/22/20 the customer changed the type of material to be installed. New material was then ordered, but would not arrive until the following week. The job was completed on 6/5/20. After the customer stated he had some issues, we returned on 6/11/20 to address them. We called the customer to let him know that the issues had been addressed. Customer called again 8 days later on 6/19/20 stating that he was still not satisfied with the repairs. A crew was sent out at the earliest possible date, which was the following week. The owner visited the job site on three different occasions prior to 6/19/20. The first time he met with the customer's wife and with the customer via telephone, the two following trips were with the customer via telephone. We made every effort to address every issue that was expressed to us. We called after the last trip on 6/19/20 to inform the customer the job was complete. After several days of no response from the customer, he called us back stating that he would "pay us when he felt like it". Despite the fact that the customer's contract states payment is due upon completion, and there is a late fee after 48 hours of non payment, we were patient, accepting and waived the late fee due to issues the customer felt he had with his project. We also gave him a discount for his inconvenience, and waited another week before calling him again. We finally received payment on 8/3/20.

In short, we were not 2 weeks behind on this job, we were 1 week late and had to be pushed further due to changes made by the customer. We made every good faith attempt to satisfy this customer, and were patient in receiving payment, despite his claims. Our goal is satisfaction and pleasant dealings with all our customers, unfortunately this is not always possible.

The entire job had previously been walked through already!! The OWNER of Shelby Fence then walked out the door and left. I followed him and “said where are you going? you can start unloading the material” which is what I thought he went to do. He said “I PASS” I don’t have time to wait I have other jobs.  (Try calling your customers to  schedule a time would be a great start!)  I then called their office the only nice person was the woman that answered the phone!... (Thank you to that lady, she was helpful & kind)..  The owner of Shelby fence then called my boss and told him he that he wasn’t doing the job and that he had just left our office. He told my boss he could COULD CARE LESS about doing the job. I can’t even imagine working for a company like that that straight out says I COULD CARE LESS! And for the record we had been waiting months on them to do the job we could have had it done 10 times over already with a different company. This company is just ridiculous! RUN AWAY!

name: Ashley McCollister
text: We are so pleased with the work and professionalism of Shelby Fence Company! I will recommend them to anyone and we will be lifelong customers. We could not be happier with the service we have received! Thanks for making our house feel complete!

name: Heidi Tenney
text: They scheduled me out weeks just to get a quote (which I was okay with) but they did not show up the day and time I was told for them to come out and quote me. A

name: Alexander Turner-Long
text: Very professional and affordable.

name: Missy Norris
text: WOW! Thoroughly Impressed. They do a great job and they do it fast. They removed an old fence and installed a new much larger fence in 2 days. The fence looks awesome!!!

name: Roy Hansen
text:
Couldn't be Happier
They came out quickly, provided me a very competitive quote. They came and installed the posts one day and then installed the fence the next. I have a very aggressive / hilly back yard they had to deal with and it turned out fantastic. Professional, quality job well done.

name: Susan Polhemus Parsons
text: Extremely unprofessional owner!

name: Ron Perkins
text: They did a fabulous job on our fence!

name: Craig Hall
text: Great job and great value

name: josh wright
text: Took a while to get back with me but their quote was well below anyone else.

name: Trey Horton
text: I used these guys once at my old home. Did a "decent" job so I called them again. Shelby Fence installed a $2k dog run that was crooked and horribly constructed. I also had also asked them to not drop concrete on my new sod that I had just paid $3k for. I was assured everything would be wonderful. I returned home only to find concrete all over my yard. I asked the mexican work force why they did exactly what I askd them not to do and they just shrugged their shoulders and mumbled something and left. Never attempting to get it up or make me happy. When I called and complained the owner thought that I was calling to try and get out of paying (far from the true) and told me he was going to come and "kick my as_!" I had to call the police on the owner/lunatic of Shelby fence! What an experience.. I would not recomend this crazy guy to anyone. Also the work is sub par. I will gladly show their work to anyone wanting to see it.

name: Fred Bamberger
text: Our wooden fence is 17 yrs old and due to normal wear and tear the latch to the gate broke. I contacted Shelby Fence and offered to come by to pay for and pick up the part. They said they would send someone over, fix the problem for free and did not charge me for a service call. After a couple of days, they did exactly that. Thanks!

name: Gale Strong
text: If you are smart, you will steer clear of this company.  I bought a D.R. Horton home with a fence installed by Shelby Fence Company.  It is very poorly installed, with the majority of it sitting directly on or jammed into the ground.  The D.R. Horton contractor told me that he would have them come out and trim off the fence above the ground.  Months after that conversation, someone from the company showed up at my home out of the blue without my knowledge while I was not at home.  My gate was locked so he could not get inside the fence.  He took it upon himself to saw off 4 or 5 boards on each side of one corner of the fence--he cut the inside boards from outside the fence.  It was cut very unevenly, and so short that my dog can now get out, totally defeating the purpose of having a fenced back yard.  I contacted the company as soon as I saw it.  The receptionist told me to email them pictures before anything else.  Three weeks later, I had no response from them and I emailed them back to complain.  At that point, I was told the fence would be fixed the next day, but that the owner was going to call me to speak to me personally.  Imagine my surprise when he was rude, arrogant, and unhelpful as could be.  Wish I had read the previous poor review before getting mixed up with this joker.  I don't know how this company stays in business.
